review.title: Best and most beautiful laptop I've ever owned!
review.review: This laptop is incredible. A bit loud, but it performs VERY solidly. It feels like a quality laptop, and for the price I can see you're getting what you pay for! It's very quick, boots up fast (Not as fast as my computer though), and it has basically the same performance of my tower that I use daily. The keyboard is a little lackluster as it's very shallow (as all laptop keyboards are), but they're very nicely lit which I love. The software that came with it was glitched and wouldn't allow me to change the color, but a simple uninstall and reinstall fixed the issue. Other than that, it has performed beautifully! It is my new daily driver for outside my desktop and I don't see myself getting anything new anytime soon!

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2019
review.title: Awesome machine, could improve in a couple areas.
review.review: This is one powerful laptop. I love that the parts are replaceable, and I have a feeling this will be my main computer for some time to come. There are a couple of things I take issue with. First, I miss the CD drive. Yes, I know it's kind of archaic technology at this point, but if you're going to build a legit laptop that has everything else, go ahead and throw that on there as well. If not a CD player, why not a card reader? I mean...come on. Anyway, I also think maybe a touch screen option would be nice. Finally, I am not a fan of the dual chargers. I intend for this laptop to stay stationary for the most part, so it's not a huge issue, but if I were taking this with me, dual GIANT charging bricks would be a burden. I would give form factor a 4(ish) out of 5 but the specs and overall function 5 out of 5.

I wish I had looked into the product reviews more, now that I have there has been tons of people that have the same complaint. Dell offers no help, Alienware is even less helpful; they just adjust your fans in the ACC (which doesn't even control the fan that makes the noise. highly disappointed overall. I hear the liquid cooled doesn't have this problem whatsoever that's probably what ill end up going to next. but for real, don't buy it with the fan cooled. review.title: Never turn on before verifications
review.review: I received the package in very good conditions exept the i heard something inside so being an IT technician I openned the machine and took a look inside.The anti-heater for the row of 4 little cubes on the motherboard was simply in liberty in the case.In my case i took my tools and ajusted it, no wires involved or anything to install into the motherboard. I did not see any other missing things but this is giving me chills since from now on i dont know if something could happen to my device and i am also not cool with the idea of sending it back and waiting again for a device that should have been ready to plug and play.I am seriously disapointed for that reason and also for the cheap feeling the big plastic case gives me.Also i bought this machine knowing about the fact the fans makes the sounds of a microwave in its late life but i was suprised to hear it by myself.Good job guys it will surely be the last time i buy a built ready to play tower computer i do not trust any manufacturer anymore. And if this one gets any problems i will do what it takes to return it and get a news.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2019
review.title: NOT A GAMING PC!
review.review: So sold as is comes with a mechanical drive, which upon doing simple tasks like opening steam or windows regularly runs at 100% thus turning this "gaming laptop" into a paperweight until the computer figures out how to do its job. After my third 2 hour session with Dell Support trying to diagnose the problem and being told there is nothing wrong with the hardware "thats just how it operates" I have determined that what I have is in fact NOT a gaming laptop as it struggles to run any games consistently through these 100% spikes. They have however said if I want to make this laptop run normally I can order 2 SSDs and have a technician come out for more money. Maybe MSI sells a more solid product.IUpdate: After getting the final quote for the new hardware and service to make the laptop functional would cost me $473. I am submitting a return to Amazon now

Occasionally I will turn it on and it will sit on a black screen forever, so I have to hard reset and then it boots just fine.Original power cord arrived with a problem in that it would have an open in the wire and lose power if not held at the perfect spot. I luckily had many of these cords stockpiled from old computers and just replaced the part of the cord that plugs into the brick.Would probably still buy again. Makes it possible for me to game outside my own home.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2019
review.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY
review.review: I've had this laptop for a little over a month and it's almost perfect. The keyboard is solid, fast processor, great graphics card. Touchpad is a little small for my liking, but I use a mouse most of the time so it doesn't bother me much. The Windows Key stopped working, but a BIOS update fixed that. A couple issues I have are that the webcam stopped working after a month of owning the machine, but I don't use the webcam often and it's just one of those nit picky things people have. However, I wouldn't recommend this laptop to anyone. I'd say save your money and get a Desktop and something along the lines of an i5 or an i7 Ultrabook.UPDATE: So, Dell support won't do anything to fix it or send me a new unit all together even though the computer is still under warranty. Also every once in a while the Windows key won't work for god knows how long. I also asked both the seller and Dell if i could get a refund and they both said no so now i'm stuck with this stupid machine and the "premium support" Dell proudly sports on the product page is a total lie.
product.title: Dell Alienware 17 R5 VR Ready 17.3" LCD Gaming Notebook - Intel Core i7 (8th Gen) i7-8750H Hexa-core (6 Core) 2.20 GHz - 1...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2019
review.title: Good but Not Great
review.review: Overall this is a good machine but I've had a few problems that have required a lot of my time fixing.Mind you I'm using a new machine with just a few games, Photoshop, and office installed.#1 - Many BSODs (Blue Screens of Death) in the first week of set up.The error codes were always different so it's hard to pinpoint to cause.I had to do several system repairs.Haven't had one in about 3 days so here's hoping that fixed it.Really though, if I'm using a brand new computer I don't want ANY BSODs hollering at me.#2 - Works great for World of Warcraft with all the graphics settings turned up to max.Oddly enough I noticed some slowdown on Sims 4 of all games.Not sure what's up with that.I was using a lot of custom content.It's not exactly a new game so I'm surprised.You can tell it's working hard when you hear the fan spinning up to cool everything down.#3 - The memory configuration sticks.two sticks of 8 GB.If you want to upgrade you're going to have to take one or both out.I really wish they'd shipped this with one 16 GB stick.Everything else I'e tried running has been smooth.Office with complicated excel sheets, Adobe Photoshop, etc.EDIT:Had to drop a star because after speaking to Alienware support, I learned that they refuse to honor the warranty on this machine if you aren't physically located in the USA.I would have bought from a competitor if I knew I wouldn't be covered in the event of stock hardware failure.Stay away if you're in Canada, the UK, or really any other country.They also start the warranty on this as of October 2018.I purchased the machine at the end of February 2019,not that it does me any good.
product.title: Dell Alienware 17 R5 VR Ready 17.3" LCD Gaming Notebook - Intel Core i7 (8th Gen) i7-8750H Hexa-core (6 Core) 2.20 GHz - 1...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2021
review.title: A Solid Work Laptop for Office & Travel
review.review: As someone who uses a 13" MacBook Pro as my personal computer, I wanted something comparable for my work set up, which requires the use of Windows to run proprietary applications. The Dell XPS was the closest Windows-based PC that I could find to the MacBook Pro, both in terms of performance and form factor.The Dell has a smaller footprint than my MacBook Pro, which already has a pretty small footprint to begin with. The thinner bezel on the XPS makes the screen look even larger than it is, while also allowing the laptop to be a good bit smaller.The OLED screen on the XPS is very nice, though it can look a little washed out at time. Overall, it's pretty crisp and 4k videos look great. I still prefer the MacBook Pro screen, but I'm not exactly a screen snob. The touch screen seems to do what touch screens do, but I don't ever use it, so I can't say how good or bad it might be on a day-to-day basis. I prefer to keep my hands off my screens.The keyboard on the XPS is nice. There isn't a ton of key travel, but enough that you can at least feel your way around and the likelihood of double-tapping keys by mistake is very slim.Performance-wise, I think it's fine for most of what I do. I believe it is a little weaker in terms of performance than my M1 MacBook Pro, but not by a huge amount. Some applications have trouble opening, Outlook freezes from time-to-time, and I have some hangups with a few Adobe CC programs that I don't get on my M1 Mac, but overall it does what I need it to do at the office.The battery life is pretty weak unless you adjust the slider way down toward the "best battery life" section rather than the "best performance" section. I understand upping performance sacrifices battery life, but even when I'm not all the way up toward better performance, the battery life takes a major hit.The webcam is trash. I'm just going to be honest. I don't really care, because I don't really do Zoom calls or anything like that, but I am admittedly shocked at how awful it is.I dock the XPS at the office and take it with me when I travel, so it's nice to have such a compact laptop with solid (albeit not elite) performance. I still have only heard the fan come on a handful of times, and it's definitely not loud and I have yet to have my thermals get out of whack. Granted, I'm not exporting 8K videos or anything. But for work tasks, I think it generally handles them well.
product.title: Dell XPS 13 9310 Touchscreen 13.4 inch FHD Thin and Light Laptop - Intel Core i7-1185G7, 16GB LPDDR4x RAM, 512GB SSD, Inte...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2021
review.title: Great pc but runs hot
review.review: I bought this laptop for work but after turning it on and trying to update everything to the latest and greatest I got BSOD. It didn't dawn on me at first to check the temp as I was running this connected to multiple monitors and I didn'tactuallyhave it in my lap. So I ran mem tests, checked event logs etc. Everything came back fine. Fired it up to full functionality and after about 30 mins on just browsing the web, BSOD again. This time checking the laptop it was hot enough that it didn't want to touch it much. So I let it cool and put a laptop cooler under it and it has worked great since. This is a design flaw I believe as to where the vents are located slightly below the inner portion of the hinge from the lid.The pc itself is great. It's fast, great graphics after I was able to keep it cool to push it and runs many applications at once including teams IDEs, etc. If I had it to do over knowing this I wouldn't buy it again It's a serious design flaw.

review.title: Excelente equipo y por el precio muy bueno.
review.review: Sin duda alguna es un producto espectacular en todos sus aspectos, llegó muy rápido, el empaque sin problemas.Puntos positivos:La construcción del equipo es completa en aluminio y fibra de carbono (me imagino que son materiales reales), la pantalla es espectacular en la versión 1080p (me imagino que la 4K es mejor) tiene mucho brillo y el táctil funciona sin problemas.El teclado se siente muy sólido y tiene un tacto espectacular al clickear, tiene retroiluminación y se ve muy bien, el trackpad sin problemas.La batería dura bastante facilmente 6 a7 horas y reduciendo todo el brillo y ahorro energético más de diez aunque con este modo se nota que disminuye un poco el rendimiento.Cosas negativas:La cámara del equipo no es tan buena, sin duda podría ser mejor.Tiene sólo entradas USB-C y el producto no viene con ningún adaptador.El procesador es bueno, pero siento que la 10a generación no es lo mejor sobretodo se siente en algunas ocasiones que el equipo se calienta un poco, no es tanto ni es un motivo para no comprar.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2021
review.title: This Pen DOES work with the Dell Inspiron 14" 7000 2-in-1!
review.review: Despite the description and some reviews, this pen DOES work on the Dell Inspiron 14" 7000 2-in-1 laptop. I had previously had a Wacom Bamboo Ink pen which I had bought for significantly more than this active pen. The Bamboo ink pen was overpriced, cheaply made, easily scratched, and the nibs chip off very easily (second day of use for me). So I decided to get the Dell Active Pen instead and it is MUCH better. The pen tip is much more durable and precise, the buttons are placed high up enough so that you aren't accidentally pressing them while writing (a problem I had with the Bamboo ink), it has a magnet to hold to your laptop, and a huge perk for me is that this pen takes AAA batteries. The Bamboo ink only took quadruple A batteries, which are not a household item for me like AAA's are. I hope this helps anyone else in the same situation so they don't have to go through the headache I did!
product.title: Dell Active Pen PN350M, Black (DELL-PN350M-BK), 5.4"

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2021
review.title: Hinge and Screen fell apart after 18 months and had to replace the keyboard - Over $900 spent
review.review: I did not realize that this model did not include a DVD drive so I had to buy one. After less than 18 months, I noticed the right hinge was popping out. That lead to me calling Dell and they were of no use, etc. and wanted $160 to analyze it. I called a local computer tech and that led to needing to replace the keyboard. Now I am faced with not being able to close the lid as the hinge issue has caused the screen to fall apart and separate. I have no idea what the repair will be this time and am faced with having to pay for an extensive body repair or buy a replacement computer. I do not recommend this product or if you do buy it, pay for the extended warranty. I have owned this computer since Dec 2018 and have already put more than $200 into it.April 5, 2021 Update: Today's repair was an additional $265. The tech had to replace the laptop body and said that he has never seen such brittle plastic in his 20 years of experience. Not only did all the little rivet's fall out, but three of the hinge screws were broken out of the plastic. What was even more depressing was that the replacement body's screen is not a touch screen as I had before. Overall, do not buy this unit. I have owned or possessed at least 16 Dells over the years via business and personal use. I am not down on Dell, but this laptop really stinks. I have over $900 invested in this laptop now. Had I had known that I would no longer have a touch screen (my first BTW), I would have just purchased a new laptop.
product.title: Dell Inspiron 15.6 Inch HD Touchscreen Flagship High Performance Laptop PC | Intel Core i5-7200U | 8GB Ram | 256GB SSD | B...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2021
review.title: Good for the price
review.review: Just received my Dell Inspiron 3000 series laptop. Was a bit annoyed that the resolution was not 1920x1080 as indicated in the listing, also disappointed that it does not have a fingerprint scanner as also indicated in the listing. That being said, once I navigated through Microsoft's attempt to keep users from installing other operating systems (aka UEFI) and dumped Windows, I was able to install Linux Mint which is running blazingly fast (was also able to tweak the system to have 1920x1080 resolution). I'm not unhappy with the purchase, but the seller needs to be more honest in their listing.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2021
review.title: Not as described
review.review: Dell makes a decent computer, so I have no complaints there. My problem is that the item is not as described. I was looking for a laptop with an optical drive so I could play dvd's and cd's. I googled those specific requirements and was directed to this laptop. Then, while on amazon, I again entered laptops + optical drive. Again, this computer came up. Under the section "ask a question" I asked if I could play dvd's on this and the answer was yes. So, imagine how disappointed I was when I saw that it has no optical drive and I'll need to buy an additional device to play the one dvd I purchased this laptop to play. So, while the laptop is okay, it didn't meet my expectations. Had I known there was no optical drive, I wouldn't have purchased it. It arrived a day before I had to leave for an extended period of time, so there was no convenient opportunity to return it.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2020
review.title: A good laptop for the cost
review.review: I've always been a fan of Dell laptops, and this is no exception.I purchased this for school and use it mainly for word processing or sharing educational videos with my class.After several months of use, I've noticed no lagging.The i5 Intel processor is a solid selling point; 10th gen is better than some of the older i7 processors I've been told.The display is sharp and clear.My one complaint is that the screen brightness doesn't go high enough.It tends to look a little dimly lit, even when plugged in.The laptop has an earphone jack, three usb ports, and an hdmi port as well as an SD card slot.This laptop has no touchscreen, and as a person who doesn't enjoy greasy, smeared screens, that's fine by me.The laptop camera is decent but nothing special.10/10 would recommend.
product.title: Dell Inspiron 15 5593: 10th Gen Core i5-1035G1, 256GB SSD, 8GB RAM, 15.6" Full HD Display, Backlit Keyboard, Windows 10

There are so many new features that I love in this laptop. My only regret is taking the 256GB version...I should have bought more storage! I love how easy Dell laptops are to use, I like the silver colour, the price and I had no problems so far. It was delivered in great condition so I’m thankful for that. If I had to state one thing I didn’t like- it’s the lack of USB ports. I really wish it came with more.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2020
review.title: Battery Life
review.review: I've been using Dell products for many years and this is the first time, I've ever been disappointed in their product.Brand new out of the box, I notice I'm only getting about 2.5 to 3.5 hours of life from the battery. It seems to me that is low compared to other laptops out there. I'm not a gamer nor do I watch many videos. I've had at least 3 Dells previous to this one and I never noticed the quick drain on the battery like this one.I talked with Dell Tech support and they tried to help but finally told be that 3 to 4 hours is what I could expect.This review is meant to inform you that no matter what you hear or believe about the life of a Dell battery, it's going to be 2.5 to 3.5 hours.Depending on how import any battery life is to you, you might want to shop around.

review.title: Large solid data storage
review.review: I use this to store video files as a backup. SSD's are great for when you need to read and write often but I prefer HDD's for simple storage and backups. You get much more storage for your buck. I've had HDD's fail at boot sector but still could use them for storage. I've never had one fail when using for storage only.Toshiba drives are solid and competitively priced. I highly recommend this drive for storage.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2020
review.title: Died in less than 6 months
review.review: The Dell E-port docking stations are basically for dinosaur computers. I ordered this item and used it for nearly 6 months with fair reliability. One day after plugging in my laptop the screen replicators stopped functioning. I tried to reset the device, swapped cables to ensure that there was no bad cables, installed new cables, etc. to no avail.Ended up having to purchase a second port replicator and it worked flawlessly upon connection. If you have the opportunity, rather than purchasing new, save some money and get a refurbished unit if they're not going to be reliable long-term.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2021
review.title: I've never regretted a purchase more! Do not buy this!
review.review: I bought this after reading a review that said it was "approaching perfection" - clearly it didn't get very close. I now know that there are multiple extremely disruptive KNOWN flaws to this machine that Dell has not fixed in years of putting out new XPS laptops. Here's a few that I've had with it right out of the box...1) Trackpad wobble. When I first got the computer I thought, this is the wobble they're complaining about? It's nothing! By a month later it was driving me insane.2) Cursor jumps around, disappears, clicks, moves when it shouldn't, etc. When it's doing this, the trackpad is unusable and you have to use an external mouse.3) The screen sometimes turns on at an extremely low brightness, far dimmer than the lowest brightness setting, and it can't be changed by turning it up. You have to turn off the screen and turn it back on again. If you don't catch that it's on (easy because it's so dim) you might end up clicking something trying to get your screen to turn on.4) One of the screws in the back corner needs to be tightened constantly or the screen section will move around.5) Blue screens at least once a week.6) Alt-tab sometimes randomly starts working, fixes with restart but it's irritating to have to do that often.7) Sometimes clicking on icons in the start bar will do nothing.8) Sometimes gets so hot that the surface is uncomfortable to rest my palm on.Another preferential thing is that I really recommend getting a computer with a USB-A port; there are still a lot of things with that plug. For example, pretty much all USB receivers for mouse/keyboard combos come with a USB-A plug. Because of the trackpad issues, the one USB-A port on the included dongle is always taken up with my mouse receiver. I had to buy my own dongle that's really irritating to carry around to accommodate anything else that needs USB-A.Do NOT buy this computer. I wanted it to last me at least 5 years and I'm not sure if I can stand using it for even one. $2000 down the drain.

review.title: Works fine with Latitude 5501
review.review: I had earlier purchased a Kensington combo lock for my Latitude 5501 and it wouldn't fit.This was also listed as compatible so I tried it and it does fit in the hole and locks.This is a key lock rather than a combo, so keep track of where you put the key.One thing that impressed me is how small the lock head is.I'm used to big clunky things hanging off the side of the laptop, but that's not the case here.
product.title: Sponsored Ad - Kensington N17 Dell Laptop Lock - Keyed (K64440WW)

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2021
review.title: Lock for Dell.Difficult to lock for some Dell models.
review.review: I purchased this lock because it was the only one that would fit the smaller wedge notch for my Dell laptops.When I push the lock into the hole for my Dell XPS 15 it goes in with no problems.However, when I push the lock into the hole for my Dell Latitude 3410 the spring loaded latch does not always close. I have to turn the lock until it gets to a spot where the latch will fully close back to its original position. I'm then able to lock it. When it's time to take the lock out I have to turn it to just the right position for it to come out. I've only had this issue on my Dell Latitude. As others have stated, the roller wheels to change the numbers are very small and close to one another. It's difficult at times of trying to turn one number without having the adjacent number turn too.
product.title: Sponsored Ad - Kensington N17 Dell Laptop Lock - Keyed (K64440WW)

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2021
review.title: Works great for DELL Alienware M17 R4
review.review: This works well with DELL Alienware M17 R4 (2020 model). By having a swivel head is a godsend. It's easy to lock and unlock from the laptop. The cable itself is fairly stiff, so you won't be able to move the laptop around much in locked position. Another plus - there is a rubber spacer between the lock to the laptop, so it will prevent the laptop (metal to metal) scratched.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2020
review.title: WORST LAPTOP EVER.
review.review: This is THE WORST laptop I’ve ever bought. I’ve had it since October, and I used it mostly for school. Thanks to COVID-19, all mu classes were online and I had to do a Zoom call pretty much every day. However, I noticed that the screen was a little off whenever I connected to a Zoom meeting. Everything, all the letters, all the faces, and all the images were blurred, and I could never fix that problem. I just got used to the idea that if I was connected to Zoom, I couldn’t use any other feature of my laptop. There were times when I needed to search for some information on Google and I had to use my phone because I couldn’t read anything!On top of that, today my laptop decided to shut down completely. I’ve charged it for hours, I’ve been trying to turn it on, everything seems to be fine, but the screen doesn’t turn on! Honestly, this was the worst investment in my life, and and to make it even worse, I had to buy it in the middle of a pandemic that affected my income, just to be able to study! Now I can’t study at all, and now that I found a job, I can’t even work properly because this laptop DOES NOT WORK AT ALL.I’ve only had it for two months, TWO MONTHS. I’ve never dropped it, I take a good care of it, I don’t even have that many documents or apps that could be damaging it somehow. It’s so frustrating to buy a thing that you hope to rely on and it turns to be a complete disaster.This is the second Dell I’ve owned, and the first one decided to die one day and I couldn’t never turn it on again. I bought another one because I was in love with that laptop. I thought it was old and that was the reason why it stopped working, but now I know that it is the brand that simply SUCKS.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2021
review.title: Hinge and Screen fell apart after 18 months and had to replace the keyboard - Over $900 spent
review.review: I did not realize that this model did not include a DVD drive so I had to buy one. After less than 18 months, I noticed the right hinge was popping out. That lead to me calling Dell and they were of no use, etc. and wanted $160 to analyze it. I called a local computer tech and that led to needing to replace the keyboard. Now I am faced with not being able to close the lid as the hinge issue has caused the screen to fall apart and separate. I have no idea what the repair will be this time and am faced with having to pay for an extensive body repair or buy a replacement computer. I do not recommend this product or if you do buy it, pay for the extended warranty. I have owned this computer since Dec 2018 and have already put more than $200 into it.April 5, 2021 Update: Today's repair was an additional $265. The tech had to replace the laptop body and said that he has never seen such brittle plastic in his 20 years of experience. Not only did all the little rivet's fall out, but three of the hinge screws were broken out of the plastic. What was even more depressing was that the replacement body's screen is not a touch screen as I had before. Overall, do not buy this unit. I have owned or possessed at least 16 Dells over the years via business and personal use. I am not down on Dell, but this laptop really stinks. I have over $900 invested in this laptop now. Had I had known that I would no longer have a touch screen (my first BTW), I would have just purchased a new laptop.
product.title: Dell Inspiron 15.6 Inch HD Touchscreen Flagship High Performance Laptop PC | Intel Core i5-7200U | 8GB Ram | 256GB SSD | B...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2021
review.title: Good for the price
review.review: Just received my Dell Inspiron 3000 series laptop. Was a bit annoyed that the resolution was not 1920x1080 as indicated in the listing, also disappointed that it does not have a fingerprint scanner as also indicated in the listing. That being said, once I navigated through Microsoft's attempt to keep users from installing other operating systems (aka UEFI) and dumped Windows, I was able to install Linux Mint which is running blazingly fast (was also able to tweak the system to have 1920x1080 resolution). I'm not unhappy with the purchase, but the seller needs to be more honest in their listing.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2021
review.title: Great pc but runs hot
review.review: I bought this laptop for work but after turning it on and trying to update everything to the latest and greatest I got BSOD. It didn't dawn on me at first to check the temp as I was running this connected to multiple monitors and I didn'tactuallyhave it in my lap. So I ran mem tests, checked event logs etc. Everything came back fine. Fired it up to full functionality and after about 30 mins on just browsing the web, BSOD again. This time checking the laptop it was hot enough that it didn't want to touch it much. So I let it cool and put a laptop cooler under it and it has worked great since. This is a design flaw I believe as to where the vents are located slightly below the inner portion of the hinge from the lid.The pc itself is great. It's fast, great graphics after I was able to keep it cool to push it and runs many applications at once including teams IDEs, etc. If I had it to do over knowing this I wouldn't buy it again It's a serious design flaw.

review.title: Very nice computer with touch pad issue
review.review: This is the first laptop I've bought in 5 years and it wasn't cheap, so I have high expectations! I've had it less than a week, so my rating is contingent, of course.There are some features I haven't yet explored. I wanted a light-weight device and it is light-weight and slim.I have the i7 processor and it is fast. I like the touch and feel of the keyboard and got used to it very quickly.The display is great - rather than the glossy effect, it is more 'matte' and is easy on the eyes.The touch-pad seems unresponsive at times, with the cursor simply stopping for several seconds, then jerking along.Maybe a setting?This is the only disconcerting aspect so I'm giving 4-stars for now.

Also I tried calling the phone number associated to the seller and it has a voice mail that has not been set up.

review.title: Great for schoolwork and can do some light gaming on the side!
review.review: My parents bought me this for my second term of college, and by do I love the upgrade. Very sleek machine and it is built very nicely. I love the fingerprint recognition, much better than having to enter your password, thats for sure. I have mostly been using it to write essays and research papers and I am able to have 30+ tabs open at the same time with no real problem. I also play some games on it-- mostly Genshin Impact as well as some lighter steam games like table top simulator-- and it works well enough on those games that I don't really have a complaint.TLDR: Great system for a student who can get by with smaller amounts of gaming

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2021
review.title: Didn't expect such a cheap scrap from DELL - Product review
review.review: First of all -- The keyboard is a joke. It feels like cheap plastic plates which sounds louder when typing. More over the the backlit keyboardis not so great and even doesn't help in a dark room. The color combination of the keyboard is BAD. It would been betterif more thinker black colored alphabets were printed on the keyboard but its a light grey coated alphabets. Didn't except such a cheap laptop for one of DELL mid-range daily use Inspiron 15 5000 laptop.Secondly, I had a laptop that screen background color is not 100% white in color - It is a mixed yellowish white -- I tried changing different graphics settings, but with no luck. The adaptive brightness setting is NOT an option on this laptop.Overall - I had the felling of being cheated with this DELL Inspiron 15 5000. If you are serious on only having a DELL laptop, then I would recommend to try other DELL Inspiron on 15 7000 series but not 5000 series.Returning this laptop on my first day of use.

review.title: This is a brick. A boat anchor. A door stop. A paper weight. It is not a computer
review.review: I've had problems from day one. Haven't even bothered to use it, it has been so slow and miserable. It began going into a restart loop a couple of months ago. I had it in the shop for three weeks and got it home Monday. "Fixed" they said. "Bad RAM" they said. $160 feckin' dollars they said.Get it home and it seems to be okay but abysmally slow. It demands I make security updates. Ok. Fine. All Windows Laptops/PCs should be able to make security updates.AND we're right back to a restart loop and completely unusable system. Never, ever, never buying a DELL again.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2021
review.title: IMHO This is a crappy keyboard and mouse pad !!!
review.review: If I had it to do over I would not buy this laptop again! I have to much money in it to throw it away and I have no children or grandchildren to give it to. I realize that it is my mistake for not researching this purchase properly beforehand. HOWEVER, I would like to meet the IDIOT that designed this keyboard and mouse pad. The keyboard has silver keys in a silver background with white/silver back lighting. Under most conditions you can not see any of the letters/numerals making it very difficult for a lousy typist like me. The mouse pad is large but requires a certain amount of force to operate so the pointer ends up usually any place other than what you want it to be. I would bet my last dollar this IDIOT never tried to use this machine after those design decisions were made. Again, my mistake but an expensive one!!!

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2021
review.title: Chose for ports and amount of RAM, already having issue w/key not working
review.review: This has the HDMI and ethernet and USB ports I needed, which were harder to find than I expected. Also the 12GB of RAM beats most of the ones in this price range. Aside from certain keys being in less convenient positions, I have had no complaints until today when I realized the Insert key works in that it presses, but it does not toggle the insert mode. It's always in overwrite mode. This feature is probably so rarely used by most users that they thought nobody would notice. However, it would make what I'm working on much easier. I also must hold Fn key to enable home and end keys to work, which is annoying but at least they work.Calling Dell support had me in tears when "Puneet" took remote control of my computer and immediately closed the browser window, despite my shouting to not do so. I had numerous tabs open with important work, and he didn't even ask, then said he made a mistake and meant to minimize it. What an idiot. I was not using Chrome (and was panicking) so I had trouble finding the "recently closed" option, which thankfully restored my tabs but what a giant tool.Anyway his test failed, meaning the key is defective, and my only option is to mail in the only computer I have right now and be without it for 2-3 weeks. I am sure there must be an easier fix, like some setting is not set correctly, but they want their sweet warranty bucks and tried selling me the premium plan. When I had a Dell in the past, a tech guy came to my home, so it's pretty galling that I'd have to pay $119 to get a defective computer fixed or be without it for weeks. (I didn't ask but assume I'd have to pay to ship it for service, which won't be cheap either.) And $119 is for a lower 1-year warranty that won't cover physical damage; that would cost $169.BTW calling support went south from the start. A voice comes on and says there are numbers on the underside of your device, so enter it now. It gives you about 2 seconds to turn the computer over and scrutinize the label to find the number among the many others. To top it off, my label was all smudged as if it had been damaged by water but stuck on anyway. I had no idea what I was looking for and the automated voice switched me to Sales, then sales switched me to tech support, and I could have easily found this service tag number by going to the Dell support page, which automatically recognizes your device and displays it. So more unnecessary stress. No wonder Dell is struggling.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2021
review.title: Almost perfect
review.review: I've been using this laptop for about a month, and I've only found 3 things that could be improved.1) the keyboard needs backlighting.I'm often working in low light situations and the lack of backlighting makes typing very difficult.I've worked around it by tilting the screen down slightly to help illuminate the keyboard.This is my biggest complaint.2) the SD card should go all the way in when inserted.Instead it only goes in about 1/2 way.This prevents you from inserting the card and leaving it there all the time.3) for some reason the F11 an F12 keys don't default to 'home' and 'end'.You have to use fcn/F11 and fcn/F12 to access those actions.This is probably a setting in configuration somewhere, but I haven't found it yet.Battery life appears to be outstanding.The unit is light and very thin.

review.title: Good for the price... Mostly
review.review: This is a decent keyboard, if you want some color, a quality mechanical keyboard for the money and a gentle sound. However the palm rest is just a piece of plastic and only takes up space. The rgb is only in zone and not individually addressable. And the feet and pads aren't that good, and still shift in a wooden desk. There are keyboards in this price range that have individually addressable, a more solid construction, better feet, and your choice of key switches. Ultimately I returned it for another brand with those features, that only cost 5 more dollars.

review.title: Hard to beat for $60!
review.review: Excellent build quality and feel for only $60. I purchased this to replace a worn out Corsair mechanical keyboard and I am not disappointed switching mechanical keys for a membrane. For half the price of a full mechanical keyboard you get one of the coolest looking keyboards on the market right now. The keys feel fine and are nice and quiet.I saw some reviews stating that the translucent plastic flexes as you type, this is just simply not the case. The keyboard feels solid with minimal flex, you have to really put in effort to make it flex.I also see many complaints about the software. While I wish it offered some more customization options, it's easy to use and serves it's purpose fine.I like this keyboard a lot and may purchase a second one for my work setup.

review.title: Not good for large hands
review.review: The product felt too small, it was uncomfortable to properly use the palm rest pad and keep my fingers on wasd. An adjustable palm rest would have been a perfect remedy ;)The thumb or spacebar key was also not ergonomic for any size hand, to hit the key you have to bend your thumpdown far enough your hand is in the shape of a L, otherwise your thumb naturally sides on the joy stick looking thing which is just a D pad with leverage making it hard to realistically use. It took a little getting used to but still was inconvenient for the tab,caps,shif, and ctrl keys to be adjusted to the size of a letter key, your pinky will definitely practice on being precise.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2021
review.title: Not for everyone...
review.review: I bought one of these on the recommendation of a friend, who swears by it.I dont have particularly small hands, but I did not find it comfortable.my hand was far more stretched out than when using a keyboard.I also quickly realized that the ability to control with the thumbpad comes with a huge drawback.I could not hit the spacebar while also using the thumbpad.To me, that makes the whole thing useless.I cant jump while moving without totally retraining one of my fingers to be the jump finger and training the others to pick up the slack. I asked my friend how he was able to use the tartarus and he said he had to completely remap everything to make it useable.While this may have worked for him due to learning to play pc games with the tartarus, I would NOT suggest this for someone who has been using a mouse and keyboard.As Ive been telling my friend when he brags about his tartarus, theres a reason why you dont see any pro gamers using these devices.
product.title: Razer Tartarus v2 Gaming Keypad: Mecha-Membrane Key Switches - 32 Programmable Keys - Customizable Chroma RGB Lighting - P...

I use it to play FPS like Valorant and I love the joystick feature I bound it to make things like checking the map or scoreboard.Pros: feels really good little fatigue that I had with my full-size keyboard after long gaming sessions.Cons: A weird thing happens sometimes where I’ll try and move diagonally and the button doesn’t work and needs to be repressed. Small but in the middle of a clutch moment can be frustrating.Overall: I love it and the pros are a light comfortable keyboard that is built well and fun to use. Not to mention it being a talking piece with my other gamer friends when they come over.

review.title: Certainly not silent (confused ordering)
review.review: My mind has just been blown. Problem is when I switched between the "Sizes", which were titled with colors, the images didn't change, and I didn't notice what was different. Realized now after reading some of the questions & answers before reviewing that the "Size" selection is actually the switch selection, which affects the sound the keys make. So yes, they come in both silent or clicky, you just need to read the whole description for each "Sizes" selection.I was after the white keyboard with rainbow LED and I am quite satisfied with that aspect, I may need to attempt an exchange though, cause I was expecting silence and got clicky.The texture on the body is so lovely, I can't describe it, like new car dashboard? review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
review.title: Software does nothing.
review.review: So I didn't realize when I bought this one that it is blue light LED's only. Which is fine. I went with blue clicky switches and they are kind of meh. Haven't taken the time to lube them but the space bar sounds incredibly hollow and different compared to the rest of the keys, you can really tell when the space is being pressed.I had to use the cable it came with to get my computer to auto-download the drivers. After that it worked with my Glorious coiled cable. Mine is a USB-C all though the ad does still show micro usb in their photos.The RK software does absolutely nothing for me, neither does the firmware download. It's a pain to get it to even download and when it does open it just shows a keyboard with absolutely no options to choose from or anything.. it literally does nothing. Also the shortcutslike (FN+||) and what not for changing to the "17" lighting modes does nothing, neither does the shortcut for brightness. So I am stuck with a mediocre lit blue LED's with no customization.Overall the keyboard looks nice and it'll be probably more of a piece of my display than using it. Would change out the clicky keys, they are a bit much..Pros are it is cheap, looks decent, can take 3 or 5 pin switches and is hot swappable. I think it could use some new stabilizers though. Overall not horrible but their software and customization is non-exsistent.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2021
review.title: The default configuration is infuriating, and it doesn't clearly indicate which mode it's in
review.review: Overall the keyboard is nice, but unlike more premium options like the Vortex Pok3r, it doesn't have any extra lights to say "hey, I'm in edit mode" or similar functions (i.e the Pok3r has a red LED to show it's on a different layer)Upon first plugging the keyboard in, it defaulted to the arrow keys being what was triggered upon pressing the slash key, right alt, menu, and right control keys, RATHER than being sensible and defaulting to the legend written on the keys. On top of that, holding function and hitting left control toggles between layers. Function, and LEFT CONTROL. This has caused MANY MANY issues, and is probably going to be the downfall of this keyboard.In Pop_OS, my OS of choice, control is used in conjunction with print screen to save screenshots to the clipboard. Which I use ALL the time. I have to fight with this thing to just take a screenshot. The Pok3r forgoes a menu key (which isn't really used much) for an extra key, labeled "pn", that's used for functions like that.There are PLENTY of things that the Pok3r does better than this keyboard. Sure, it's double the price, but at the same time, it's built significantly better!TL;DR:Save the extra money and get a Pok3r
product.title: RK ROYAL KLUDGE RK61 Wireless 60% Mechanical Gaming Keyboard, Ultra-Compact 60 Keys Bluetooth Mechanical Keyboard with Pro...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2021
review.title: NOT a gaming keyboard!
review.review: How in the hell did Logitech get away with labeling this as a gaming keyboard?It's "mechanical" keys are slimy feeling- just like membrane keys. A non-removable palm rest. And idk bout y'all but when I game, it's in the pitch black darkness. I need backlit keys or light of some kind! I'm good on this one. Returned and getting the 915 with beautiful clicky keys.And since I got the combo. the MX Master is not a BAD mouse either... it's ergonomically fitting to my hand, a nice change to the sometimes too-small gaming mice that Logitech designs for my bigger hands.. But the side scroll is defunct and the forward/back buttons are literally on top of each other in a diagonal fashion. This makes it very tough to hit the correct button the first time. Worst of all however is the fact the polling rate is only 125hz. They say you miss 100% of the shots you don't take.. well with this mouse you can take 100 shots and miss a damn well lot of them due to the low rate. Again, returning this as well and getting the G502 wireless.Logitech needs to rethink their branding for this keyboard/mouse. You can even see from a lot of the reviewers here, this is ideally an OFFICE keyboard/mouse setup. Not a gaming setup! The gaming equivalents are the G915 keyboard and G502 or G903 or G604 or G703 or.. y'know what? There's a lot of good logitech gaming mice out there.. But just 1 (wireless) gaming keyboard by logitech worth it's price.
product.title: Logitech G613 LIGHTSPEED Wireless Mechanical Gaming Keyboard, Multihost 2.4 GHz + Blutooth Connectivity - Black

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2021
review.title: Bought 2, switches went bad in both, manually soldering in new switches is a pain!
review.review: The first keyboard I purchased started having bad switch issues about 3 months in. The switches would routinely duplicate the letters, and at one point even the backspace key failed (same style switch). Thankfully the switches are replaceable with a little soldering skill, but this is a real nuisance. Because I was in a rush (and thinking Logitech may have just gotten a bad batch of switches during assembly), I bought a second keyboard, identical model, different batch. STILL having switch failures. On the original keyboard I have now replaced a total of EIGHT switches, on the newer one I've had to replace two.Until/unless Logitech gets better switches I would avoid this keyboard. I didn't bother going through customer service because I knew I could repair this issue myself, but not everyone has the tools or is handy. If you're handy and don't mind replacing switches, I've otherwise enjoyed the keyboard. Keystrokes are nice, responsiveness is excellent, and the range of the wireless is great. But c'mon Logitech, for the cost of this keyboard I shouldn't be having switch issues. Two stars because this is a serious flaw.
product.title: Logitech G613 LIGHTSPEED Wireless Mechanical Gaming Keyboard, Multihost 2.4 GHz + Blutooth Connectivity - Black

review.title: Broke Within 4 Days of Use
review.review: I ordered this larger, sturdier keyboard as a replacement for another I had purchased within the week before, that came with a faulty FN key and made secondary functions useless, which was an incredible issue as the keyboard only had 60% of its keys.Within FOUR DAYS of using this keyboard, for simple work functions I would like to add, nothing intensive, it broke. The RGB’s panicked, shut down, only returned the rim lightning to “normal” after unplugging and replugging, and left the actual keyboard completely and utterly unusable.NONE of the keys worked. I tried pushing reset buttons, pulled the cord again, let the keyboard sit, attempted to utilize the company software, NOTHING fixed it. For $80 before tax, this was beyond upsetting, an incredible waste of time, and has left me in a bind with my working capabilities as I don’t have another readily available keyboard to use in its place.I should mention, this was on a Windows computer, not a Mac. I will be returning ASAP.

RTL-SDR Blog V3 R820T2 RTL2832U 1PPM TCXO HF Bias Tee SMA Software Defined Radio with Dipole Antenna Kit

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2021
review.title: VERY disappointed - too much hype and unreasonable expectations as a result
review.review: I watched a YouTube video about this specific product by what seemed to be a knowledgeable and experienced individual.I came to Amazon to see what I could find, and the description seemed to correspond to what the independent (?) YouTube video reported.There were some negative reviews, but there are almost always at least some.If they're less than 10% especially, and if the 5-star ratings are substantially high, I will usually try the product and I generally end up satisfied.The YouTube video STRESSED following instructions for installation and use with 3rd party software, which I followed step by step.The fact that the instructions weren't written by the company itself should not be held against the product, but I found it rather difficult to follow the instructions despite having been a general class amateur radio license holder for many years, with considerable familiarity with electronics in general.I was highly disappointed.I may have gotten a single defective unit, but I decided to return it and not bother with a replacement.Amazon was outstanding with an almost immediate refund as soon as the UPS Store registered their receipt of the product for return.Amazon is GREAT in that regard!First, the device was extremely(!) hot!I could only barely stand to hold it in my hand for more than a few moments to remove it from the computer.I cannot believe that's standard, and if it is, I don't believe it's properly designed.One of the major reasons for failure of electronics is heat - and this is quite excessive in my opinion and experience.Second, despite good familiarity with antenna theory and significant attempts to maximize the antenna tuning to the desired frequency of reception, I was never able to tune in ANY stations outside of the usual FM Radio broadcast band beginning at 88.0 mhz.No lower, no higher frequencies that just that band.I can listen to other FM radios in my home without spending nearly $50 for this.Again, I may have had a faulty unit based on many of the reviews, but decided it wasn't worth another try, at least with this brand.And in any case, be prepared to do some study about antenna design and characteristics as well as getting some software that will properly tune everything together (antenna and this product).I was excited about this, and hoped for far more.Yes, I am indoors with it, but others report far better results indoors, and I placed the antenna right next to an outside window with almost nothing nearby to provide interference (which I didn't seem to be picking up anyway with the receiver.Your mileage may vary, in all fairness.
product.title: RTL-SDR Blog V3 R820T2 RTL2832U 1PPM TCXO HF Bias Tee SMA Software Defined Radio with Dipole Antenna Kit

review.title: Works great with Roccat Vulcan 120 AIMO.
review.review: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. My keyboard is a Roccat Vulcan 120 AIMO. Until recently, it was a $200 keyboard, and I still believe it has some of the best RGB of any keyboard on the market.The keycaps that come on this keyboard are just little key toppers and they do not extend down and around the mechanical switch at all. The designers wanted to show the switches as much as possible and it looks great from the factory, but it looks so much better with these replacement pudding keycaps. It feels like the old keycaps were letting too much light escape, but with these translucent pudding keycaps, it traps the light and spreads it out.I recommend anyone with an RGB keyboard get a set of these keycaps! The only thing I don't like is the hyperX branding on the space bar. But there are still a great value.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
review.title: Who designed these key faces??!
review.review: I used a K70 with brown switches for a few years before it finally kicked the bucket during a move and I decided to throw down some real cash on a new one. While I like the low-profile approach to this keyboard, whoever decided to not only NOT illuminate the shift characters but also flip their position on the key faces is an absolute imbecile and should not have any say on designing a keyboard in this price range. That kind of design decision is something I expect out of the junk keyboards I get when purchasing refurbished computers for my company...not an $185 gaming keyboard.All that said, outside the lighting and stupid character layout decision, the rest of the keyboard works quite nicely. I have a little bit of a "springy" sound on my "s" key that's been there since day-1 but otherwise no hardware issues to speak of.Software wise, it's really annoying to have to use G-hub constantly if you want this keyboard to be really functional. I say that because without G-hub running the keyboard defaults to a pattern where it flashes all the colors in a big wave which gets incredibly distracting in your peripherals. If you turn off lighting entirely the same idiot that designed these key faces decided to do dark grey on black. It doesn't impact myself as I've spent 8hr+ a day on a keyboard for 15yrs now but if you don't know how to memory type you're going to be up the creek without G-hub running and you're really going to hate finding those rare shift characters.If you're someone just starting out coding this keyboard is especially not for you, you're basically going to be chicken pecking like your dad because you can't see a thing.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2021
review.title: Powerful PC that will accomplish any task
review.review: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I was a bit worried when I ordered this PC because it shipped from Delaware and I live in California. After 4-5 days, it made its journey safety across the United States with no issues thankfully. The PC is packed into precut high quality foam, wrapped in plastic, inside a thick cardboard box. I have not used tech support yet so no comment on that.I have only had the pc a week and a half, but so far so good. PC comes preinstalled with windows 10 and some bloat ware such as Microsoft one drive, Mc Afee, and a few other programs. Omen gaming hub is nice software that you can use to customize the lights on your pc, overlock your processor, and to watch your temps. Reading a lot of reviews beforehand I know this pc can run really hot, and that was my main concern. I installed cyberpunk 2077 and ran it on ultra setting with ray tracing. It looks beautiful but the pc did get quite loud. It also got pretty hot too. My CPU bounced around 88-91 C, where this processors max temp is 100 C before it shuts off. After turning Vsync on and ray tracing off, the temps and loudness dropped significantly. CPU sits in the 70s C and GPU sits in the 60s C.I live streamed all weekend a couple games: world of Warcraft and cyberpunk 2077. The processor can easily handle high end gaming and streaming at the same time, as long as you are reasonable with the settings. If you’re playing cyberpunk 2077 on ultra ray tracing while streaming, your computer will get very hot and loud. If you cap vsync at 60 or 90 frames, you shouldn’t have an issue with high heat or noise. Remember, this processor and graphics card are powerful hardware, they will get hot! The case and fans does it’s job though if you’re playing games on medium settings. I keep my fans on turbo and Vsync on and don’t have any issues with overheating or loudness. I haven’t overclocked my PC yet. Like any powerful gaming rig, this PC is a space heater! It will need to sit on a desk or in the open air. Your room will get warm. It feels nice right now during these cold nights but I can’t imagine this PC in the summer with no a/c.You will be pleased at how this PC performs. You will have to find the right settings for you to keep the temps and loudness at bay when running demanding games, but that’s to be expected with such powerful hardware in a snug case. Older games like WoW you don’t need Vsync. I get 300-400 fps on max settings.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2021
review.title: the temperature problem
review.review: I purchased this Omen 30L (HP Model# GT13-0092) over a month ago. I have no complaints besides how expensive PC gaming is... lolGPU = RTX 3080CPU = Intel Core i9-10850K.32 GB RamI want to address the number 1 complaint I found while researching this PC, the temperatures. The temperatures and fan noise but it's all related. Yes, it is a problem. Things get too hot (80C+) and the fans kick on the high setting during gaming. It was a common thing before I looked into fixing it.The temperature problem is with the CPU. That's the liquid cooled part and it is liquid cooled because CPUs run hot in general. You should first make sure those lines are not kinked. I read about that being a thing for some people.The next thing you should do to fix the temperatures is to reduce the maximum power the CPU uses. You can find it in the advanced power settings for the computer. There is a section where you can select the minimum and maximum power states of the CPU. Instead of 100%, max the CPU at a few percent less. I can tell you from experience that 95% works great but you may be able to get away with 98% (I'm currently testing this).This has proven to be a great fix for the temperature problem in my experience with it. I'm not even concerned about it anymore. This Omen PC is limited by the GPU and not the CPU so running the CPU at 95-98% doesn't affect performance. Even with my CPU at 95%, games tell me that the GPU is my bottleneck.About the noise of the fans. I think it's a little ridiculous that people complain so strongly about it. I don't think the fans are overly loud. Definitely perfectly quiet when they are running normally and with the fix I mentioned it's basically always that way. But with that said, I heard a youtuber complaining about how loud hard drives are when they click while loading. If you are someone bothered by hard drives clicking then yes, the fans are too loud for you as well. PC gamers...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2021
review.title: Sleeper deal of the year!
review.review: This machine just ROCKS! I bought it primarily for video editing and was a little skeptical due to some of the reviews about the display and speakers. But I took a chance...and now I'm really glad I DID! Great features for the price. I don't play online games so I'll never use some of the features like the assignable keyboard color schemes or overclocking, but this machine has all the graphics power I need and didn't cost me a fortune. Plenty of USB ports. Since most of my cameras use SD cards I truly appreciate the built-in SD card reader slot. Extremely easy to upgrade memory and add a 2nd drive - that was a big one for me. Fan noise was VERY minimal and not an issue at all for me (others said it was loud) even when overclocked. It DOES make a bit more noise when overclocked, but (duh!) that's the fans doing their jobs and keeping you from frying your processors. And as for my display and audio worries? Well...I don't know what kind of displays the folks who were critical of it were used to, but this thing is PLENTY sharp and bright enough for me to edit with. Good color representation with plenty of range and no banding or blocking. Deep blacks, great grays, and amazing color. The audio is also PLENTY loud for my purposes. Even with just the built-in speakers, this machine pumps out all the volume I need while keeping it nice and crisp. And if I want more, I'll just patch it in to my studio sound system and make the neighbors start complaining on me...LOL! All in all, this is a TERRIFIC laptop and I would highly recommend it to anyone! Don't worry too hard about it...just BUY it!

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2021
review.title: Terrible quality.....2nd HP Omen with quality problems
review.review: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. First, your mileage may vary (YMMV)Wow, where do I begin....Ordered the HP Omen 15 (15-dh1060nr, 2020 Model) the first week of Jan 2021.Had great features, components and ports that I was looking for.It came fairly quick from Amazon which was great.I started the setup of the laptop but noticed that when the laptop was plugged in and on, power to the laptop was only coming from battery power.When I shut down the laptop, the battery then recharged.So I had only 3 to 4 hours of use before I had to shut down and recharge the laptop.I was on with HP support and it was determined that nothing could be done and that I should send it back....this was less than 12 hours from receiving the laptop.Contacted Amazon for a return and they sent a replacement which was great.I received the replacement HP Omen 15 (15-dh1060nr, 2020 Model) and first checked to see that the battery and the charger was working properly....yes!It was.So then I setup the laptop and the performance, features, etc has been great....fast forward to 4 days after receiving the laptop, I hear a grinding noise in one of the 2 fans.Its a loud noise that is clearly not right.The sound is like a labored sound...definitely noticeable in a quiet room and this is at Comfort level with the Omen Control software.I contacted HP and requested a replacement fan.The fan replacement looks easy from Youtube and access to the fans are easy.No go...the only option is to send it to their repair center.They are sending me a shipping box and I will be without this laptop for a week or a bit longer.I have been a fan of HP but these 2 quality problems on a mid to higher end laptop has me questioning what's going on with HP.Pros:Great specs, performanceGreat price from AmazonGreat return policy from AmazonCons:Suspect quality...first with power supply and batterySecond with defective fanTime spend having to deal with thisUpdate:March 20, 2021I am updating my 1 star review to 3 stars.I'm not going to ever give 5 stars to a product that had 2 separate quality issues that made the product unusable.In January, I did send my my laptop to HP for repair...yes, a laptop that was 1 week old.A week later, I did receive the replacement back through Fedex.The product was properly protected and it has been working great ever since.I agree with the other reviews that this laptop is easy to upgrade.I have added 32MB of RAM as well as a Seagate Firecuda 2TB Internal NVME SSD which is very easy to do.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2021
review.title: This product is shipped by Computer Upgrade Kings
review.review: Very disappointing. Does not appear CUK actually upgraded anything. I was forced to purchase the RTX 3070, because the RTX 3080 is not an available option when you select the 10900KF processor. This model was sold out on the HP website, otherwise, I would have purchased it there, where I could have upgraded the GPU. It is all HP OEM branded components and the instructions provided with the PC were not even accurate (did not list the proper procedure to even open the case). The memory is HyperX Fury RGB, which was bought out and re-branded by Kingston, so you cannot purchase an upgrade through normal channels. All other HyperX products are now owned by HP. The Omen RGB software does not even work with the HyperX memory RGB. This machine is marketed as a gaming PC, but comes with the very basic HP wired keyboard and mouse. Performance is okay, but there is no tweaking software. The whole setup feels cheap for the price. If not for time constraints, I would have elected another vendor. To top off the insult to injury, you can only return it if it is DOA. Total amateur hour here.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2021
review.title: Great features, plenty of GPU, well built.
review.review: I'll start with the feature I hate; That stupid logo.Would someone please tell HP to make and give out an adhesive medallion that simply says 'HP' like on the 15" model, so I can stick it over that lousy...whatever it is.. on mine. I'd like to sneak it into the office, but I will have to explain that logo, which I cant even explain now. Its also ugly.Ok, now the (very) good...This version has more features than I expected. The bios and mainboard not only supports undervolting, (earlier versions of the 17" omens did not) but they've even designed a feature where the user can select either 'Optimize' the undervoltage setting by automatically finding that sweet spot, or 'Custom' where you can set it yourself. The screen is bright and has great color and contrast. The mousepad feels nice and responsive. The fans aren't too noisy, its about the volume I expected when running full speed. Now, about 'sneaking it into the office'; if your worried about fan noise, there's an app that comes with the Nvidia GPU that you can access and set it to 'Whisper mode', and what that will do is it will cap the framerate to whatever you want,the lowest being 30 FPS, which is aboutstandard blu-ray or DVD movie framerate anyway, and that will help keep the fans from spooling up.Two reasons I picked the 17" is because I wanted a bigger screen, but also wanted a laptop that can dissipate heat, and I feel many of those thin designs might have difficulty there. There were some concerns about the hinge design and positions and screen torsional flex, but now that I can see them for myself, I am unconcerned and I would say they are fine. They are pretty firm, and there is some screen flexing, but just a littlemore than the other laptops I own.The final deciding factor is that I've had good experience with HPs. The last two companies I worked for used HP exclusively for their laptops, and I own a 17" HP Envy which was a beast when I got it 7 years ago, its still my go-to business laptop to this day with zero issues.I believe the Omen 17" laptop will give you the best bang for your hard earned buck.I just hate that logo, whatever its supposed to be.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2021
review.title: Good laptop, but buyer be wary of sellers shipping modified lower-spec models
review.review: I bought the HP Omen 15 15-EN-0023DX last year and it's been a great laptop so far. Gaming performance is on par with what I expect out of the GTX 1660 Ti, and the Ryzen 7 4800H is just fantastic. The laptop became my daily driver for most uses, as it outperforms my overclocked Core i7-8086k desktop in everything but gaming.Multi-monitor support is not the greatest: I have 2 4k external monitors, and I have to drive 1 off of DisplayPort and one off of DisplayLink over USB. I could not get DP MST working over the DisplayPort, even though it should be capable of 2x 4k60. I could get them both working via DisplayLink, but DisplayLink has issues with some software (mostly games) so it wasn't viable for me.Major shortcomings of the Omen 15 are a lack of Thunderbolt support (not really surprising since TB is Intel, but nothing prevents HP from putting a TB controller in an AMD laptop), and no support for USB PD. The former is somewhat excusable, but the latter is baffling. Sure, you can deliver more power via the power brick, but outside of gaming, you're never going to exceed the power limits of USB PD. Thunderbolt + USB PD gives single-cable convenience: just plug your laptop into a docking station and you're done. Instead, I have a mess of cables to deal with every time I want to take the laptop with me.In regards to the "buyer be wary" bit: I purchased the 15-EN-0023DX, but actually received a 15-EN-0013DX (normally 8GB RAM and 512GB SSD), that the seller had upgraded to match the specs of the 15-EN-0023DX. This went undetected until I sent the laptop in for warranty service with HP, who declined to repair the laptop, since it had 3rd party components in it. I have contacted the seller to address this (no response yet), but the seller should never haver voided the warranty in the first place. Check your serial number with HP to confirm that you indeed have the model you ordered, or you might run into the same problem.

Keyboard is quiet, which is what I wanted. I own a Razer mechanical and wanted something that wouldn’t wake the dead. A good buy for me and probably most people out there.

review.title: HP is very unprofessional
review.review: Bought early October for 1400, after a week (right after refund policy ends) it started getting random crashes that happen even if nothing is running on computer. At first thought it was steam or a programming site I was using to learn c++ crashing but now in March I find out though event viewer when I first started laptop 10/3/20 it had critical errors kernel 2 and 41 (usually mean bad power supply) which means they never tested laptop before it shipped and could possibly be pre owned, so the power supply has major issues and is destroying the computer, if you’re considering getting a laptop like this go with one of the asus laptops or something... this was by far the worst purchase I have ever made. HP won’t stand behind its product and now I’m stuck with a laptop that will most likely brick itself before May, and accordingto HP it has nothing to do with them cause return policy ended, which is 7 days after purchase. Hp literally kept telling me it’s my fault for not knowing it had the power supply issues sooner. So now I have a really expensive paperweight and really can’t afford another laptop like this so thanks HP for making thing as difficult as possible

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2021
review.title: Bang for your buck should be name for this thing.
review.review: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Although I was very wary to make this purchase due to the lack of in-depth photos from OMEN, (like c'mon guys...really?) I got to say I was pleasantly surprised. With a simple sleek design, the omen 30L looks very nice sitting on my desk and has built-in software for the RGB that is actually was a very nice and customizable to set up which is great! **HOWEVER** the cable management is sloppy, to say the least. Packaging was solid and there was no cosmetic or internal damage. And, Omen was nice enough to send the saddest mouse and keyboard I ever did see, but I can respect it for someone who doesn't already have one. (Disclaimer) if your using HDMI to plug into your tv, this rig does not come with a cable in the package!! (it only comes with a power cable) Luckily I already had one on hand.. This surprisingly has a good amount of ports on front and back and accommodated everything I had to plug-in.Starting up was a breeze, the instructions were clear and you will be up and running in less than 15 minutes. For what you pay for you get a pretty powerful machine. Booting up apps and games is not a 5-minute wait. Logging into games usually takes anywhere from a minute to a minute and a half. The geforce rtx 3060 is great and knowing that they are almost impossible to get right now, shows its a steal to get it in this rig. This has no problem running shaders on Minecraft such as BSL, and SEUS at 60 fps in 1080 averaging about 40 degrees celsius for the CPU.Also (Geforce has a built in software that makes checking how your internals are running (fps, cpu temp, ect.) at the touch of a button. Literally alt+z. It is very intuitive and a great add-on. For noise, the fans stay silent but sometimes rise to a dull hum even after running for 8 hours plus, but it really is pretty silent for the most part. For the money and the way pc parts are slim at the moment, I would say this is a pretty good buy. And i never leave reviews but on amazon there are no reviews (another reason I was wary on buying) so I felt I should let the people know whats up. For an average gamer, this thing is a steal and more than enough to handle most games. Im pretty happy with it, although like most reviews, they say the airflow in the case is less than satisfactory, and it is i guess. It hasn't given me any real problems yet, but the top of the case is a grate which should let air through because heat rises right? Wrong, there is another mount for another fan right on the inside of the pc at the very top, blocking airflow, and its has no holes to let air through. SO if you have money left over, you can buy a new case with better air flow or a new fan to mount there. But if your poor and cant afford another fan, you can actually take it out (unscrewing 2 screws) and there are 4 squares in the middle of the mount that with enough force you can pop out and open up a ton of airflow. Or you can just leave the mount out, but I would rather put it back in fear of losing it. AndI know it sounds weird now, but when you see it you will understand. But enough of that. This pc is really awesome for the price, and I brlieve it is worth getting.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2021
review.title: Great gaming laptop for the price
review.review: This is an awesome laptop, but there are two things keeping me from giving it a 5-star review. One is the fact that it only comes with 8 GB of ram. This is easily upgraded though. The main issue I had with it was how aggressively (and sneakily) they try to force you to use OneDrive. I only keep ONE file on my OneDrive, but it will try to save everything on there if you don’t turn it off or uninstall it at your initial startup. And I didn’t know it until I got a pop-up saying my OneDrive was full. Other than that, great machine! It’s put up with everything I’ve put it through so far!
product.title: HP - OMEN Gaming 15.6" Laptop - AMD Ryzen 7 - 8GB Memory - NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1660 Ti - 512GB SSD - Mica Silver

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2021
review.title: Great value for money!
review.review: I have had this laptop for a few weeks now and I am pleased with the overall product, particularly with its performance. It stays relatively cool and the fans don't get too loud under it's lower power options when not being pushed to do demanding task. Under a heavy load though it can get quite loud as expected(jet engines).As for the battery. It is good when compared to other gaming laptops with the same specs but I wish it were better and able to last the day doing regular task but unfortunately you'll only be able to squeeze around 6 hrs out with continuous use. This is a minor inconvenience to me personally.Lastly, when it comes to this computers design, the keyboard has an excellent feel , the hinges work great and have a good level of resistance preventing any screen wobble. The two biggest problems for me also had to do with design. The sharp edges around the laptop are annoying, while it won't cut you it is noticeably uncomfortable against the wrist while typing. My absolute biggest complaint though, the laptop is not level for some reason, it wobbles when put on flat surfaces and the base appears to be curved (this could just be my model but it annoys the hell out of me).Overall this is a great gaming laptop and one of the best you can get today at it's price point.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2021
review.title: Pretty good laptop but one problem
review.review: Bought this to replace a 5 years old laptop to do some casual video editing and 3D modeling. For my purposes, this laptop works great! I also occasionally play some light games and this laptop has no problems at all. Not sure how well it does with the latest and the greatest though.Overall I'm pretty happy with it, but there is one problem which may annoy some people. Whenever this laptop is on, it emits high pitch audible noise. I initially thought it was the fan noise, but it's present even when the fans are not spinning and sounds like the noise is coming from some power components on the motherboard. I got used to it and don't mind, but I do know a few people who can't take this type of high frequency noise. If you are one of them, please beware!Update: Apr 6, 2021Just after posting my original review, an update was pushed which significantly reduced the high pitch noise coming out of this laptop. I can still hear it while the fans are spinning, but the noise is gone when the fans are not running.

The Fn + Space works just fine for me for lighting control using (what I assume is) the Lenovo Function (Fn) driver only, and all else is BIOS or Windows controlled well enough. Screen is nicer than I expected and build quality seems solid. Fast and games well at its price point. Will update this review at a later date, after some usage.
