review.title: Best Mid-grade optical gaming mouse
review.review: Sometimes you don't want a mouse with a bazillion buttons. You want it for work and gaming without spending a stupid amount of money. Enter the Steelseries Prime FPS gaming mouse....not too fancy, built well and is a real delight to use. Sturdy, rugged and accurate for gaming. This mouse is a great buy for the money and proves you don't need to spend $ hundreds on a mouse with 42 buttons. If you like your mice, simple and sturdy/well built, this is the mouse for you. I replaced my razer mouse because it was starting to double-click in gaming.
product.title: Sponsored Ad - SteelSeries Aerox 3 Wireless - Super Light Gaming Mouse - 18,000 CPI TrueMove Air Optical Sensor - Ultra-li...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2021
review.title: Working well
review.review: Mice are like shoes, so it's difficult to say what works well for everyone. I use a mouse 14+ h/day for long days at work and then what time I can have saving the universe. I've owned about every brand, both wired and wireless. My latest venture with the SteelSeries was based off a YT vid review that just happened to play. I'd been using a Razer Viper Mini for the past year and while it was a good mouse, it's just a bit too mini for me (average size hands).I've been pleased so far with this mouse. The weight is lighter than most, which I've increasingly grown to appreciate. I don't care much for wireless mice, so this wired one was my preference. The cable is ok - no kinks and with my setup, no drag/pull as I'm moving around. I already had a SteelSeries keyboard, so the software worked without issue picking up the mouse and adjusting settings. I've never had issue with SteelSeries software before, so that's been a non-issue as well.The mouse feels pretty good and has no plastic stuck on the sides like some of SteelSeries other mice. Those glued on pieces are nothing short of a mess over time as they goop out and get on your desk/hands/mouse. This mouse is all solid and is comfortable for long usage times. Clickers work well andthe wheel was surprisingly better than I feared - not exactly smoot, not horribly bumpy.Overall, I like this mouse and for the money, feel like I got a good product for the cost. I generally go through mice every 1 to 3 years, depending on how they hold up. I'm hoping this holds up to the task.
product.title: Sponsored Ad - SteelSeries Aerox 3 Wireless - Super Light Gaming Mouse - 18,000 CPI TrueMove Air Optical Sensor - Ultra-li...

Lighting is saved to the mouse too, so I don't even need the software running. Clicks are crisp, and reliable, and its lightweight feels great. Just wish there was a wireless version with the exact same layout (yes I know the 650 exists)

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: Completely useless for my target purpose (gaming)
review.review: I've had a SteelSeries Rival 310 for a couple of years now and am perfectly happy with it, but then I found out about this model which seemed like a straight upgrade to me after watching and reading a couple of reviews. After getting it out of the box, I was excited to test it out in my favorite game, DOTA 2. Very quickly however I found out that unlike the two side buttons of the Rival 310, which are extremely easy and super natural to press, all 5 of the side buttons of the Rival 5 were exceedingly difficult and unnatural to press, and also led to mouse movement due to the force required to press the buttons. Also, my thumb had to be in a very weird and cramped position to be able to press the side buttons at all. The big forward side button was basically impossible to press, and the up/down rocker was very difficult to press as well. From the natural thumb resting position, it requires a significant movement to be able to press even the closest two ("back/forward") buttons, unlike with the Rival 310 where those buttons are basically instant-press as soon as you think about them. Therefore, this mouse is completely unusable for playing Dota 2, and I would guess any other game.I have medium to slightly large sized hands, and I would imagine someone with very large hands / long fingers, or some specific grip style might be able to use the side buttons (I am using a standard grip), but for me they are completely unusable. Again, the Rival 310 side buttons are perfectly usable so I'm unsure why they decided to move them way out of reach.The other features of the mouse are fine, as is the build quality, although I heavily dislike the default-on lighting, and the fact that the RGB lighting settings are NOT stored on the mouse itself, so if you use it with a different PC or laptop on which you don't have the SteelSeries software installed, you are forced to have your mouse glow super bright in random colors. The cable is OK too.I hope they make a "real" upgraded version of the Rival 310, with more side buttons, that are natural to reach, like the two existing ones, and not this "apparent" upgrade which is really a huge downgrade.
product.title: SteelSeries Rival 3 Gaming Mouse - 8,500 CPI TrueMove Core Optical Sensor - 6 Programmable Buttons - Split Trigger Buttons...

I chose to return the item as it did not state this information in the listing. Otherwise this mouse is great.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: Super comfortable, great sound quality, relatively easy to set up.
review.review: I'm so glad I decided to just shell out the extra money for a good headset. Steelseries engine has preset equalizers. one is Flat, one is Voice, they sound like shit, as expected. but man, when you set the equalizer to Music? shiiiiiiiiiiit. these things sound incredible when you have some spotify blasting. just out of the box they sound good. but downloading the engine and trying different presets is nice.they're also super comfortable. the velcro makes it weird trying to find the right fit but it only takes 2 minutes of fidgeting around to find it. if that. the earpads are crazy soft and squishy, they feel great. I wear glasses too. no problem. they might feel weird at first, you just have to find the right fit with the velcro. they sit on your head and around your ears so seamlessly.the mic is basically what you would expect from a headset. it doesn't sound incredible but it's good for what you pay for. it's better than most i've heard.has a volume scroll wheel on the left ear to raise or lower your volume. very nice.its great,buy it.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
review.title: Mediocre pricey headset
review.review: I picked these up to replace a broken pair of Turtle beach Stealth 520s.The 520s were cheap <$100 and did the job as intended.Honestly I would prefer to go back with them,and not this Artis 7 headset.My biggest gripe is that I cannot use the headset to control Chat and Audio separately,You need to use the PlayStation console to do this,and its annoying as Heck!That feature alone makes the cheaper Turtle beach headset dominate these things.Another point of contention is how long you need to push the power button down to turn them on..Literally 4 Mississippi's before they beep and power up.The instructions say that you need to hold the power button down for 5 seconds to pair it,beware.... it has gone into that mode rather then turn on a few times.Sound quality is passable but not exceptional or worth noting and at this price point its disappointing.Positives..They fit better then the Stealth 520sbut are actually abit heavier,will need to see how they sit on the long term.Battery life so far is good on par with my old set,microphone is overly complicated and cannot be removed from the headset.Not a big deal,but worth noting.Summary...Mediocre pricey headset..They do nothing outstanding,and controlling audio is super annoying with these.Sound quality is good but not great,Noise cancelling is non existent.I use for gaming,would not recommend these for any audiophiles.Wired headsets on the cheap end perform better.
product.title: Sponsored Ad - SteelSeries Arctis Prime - Competitive Gaming Headset - High Fidelity Audio Drivers - Multiplatform Compati...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2021
review.title: Trash
review.review: I can't believe I have to write something bad about a new mouse. I've had a sharkoon mouse since 2014 and now it hurts my fingers to click. So I bought this crosair mouse. I didn't buy it because I'm left handed. I got it because of the two right side buttons. I'm not sure why gaming mouses don't have right side buttons. So basically I got this mouse for the buttons.I play 3 different action MMORPGs with action combat, using mouse clicks for skills.The left side buttons are so faulty and trash. There's friction between my finger and the mouse skills popping off when I click.This mouse was not designed for gaming... The left side buttons are too far forward and flimsy. It does not feel like I'm pressing a button, more like reaching for something unsecured and difficult to push.The clickers need to pressed rather than lightly touched. I find this to be harder to deal with ... Think about slamming your hand flat on a table, this is what it feels like to press the clickers.Something more annoying than the buttons is the failure to load. Sharkoon always loads, crosair does not.I have had to restart computer, unplug and replug, even loaded the ique software. Why? Because the mouse DOES NOT COME ON.. A few times it shut off completely. Unable to scroll and lost cursor...Do you know how ANNOYING this is?I like to have a mouse with right side buttons... But honestly my old sharkoon is waaay better!
product.title: Corsair M55 RGB Pro Wired Ambidextrous Multi-Grip Gaming Mouse - 12,400 DPI Adjustable Sensor - 8 Programmable Buttons - B...

review.title: Not a good keyboard
review.review: The spacebar required significant force to actuate. It was resulting in quite a few command line errors. I had to significantly alter the way I type in order to increase my accuracy which is not acceptable.The spacebar also has a tilt on it that causes you to press on the edge of the key and not the flat. review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2019
review.title: Scroll Wheel problem after less than 1 year
review.review: This mouse is fairly comfortable and performed well when it was purchased.I liked the DPI settings.The buttons on the left side got in the way sometimes, but I learned to hold the mouse a specific way to avoid accidentally clicking them all the time.I am leaving a 1 star review because after less than 1 year the scroll wheel is essentially unusable, jumping up or down randomly when I try to scroll.I did a search to see if this is a common problem, and other users suggested blowing into the scroll wheel area.I tried that, and found it provided a functional scroll capability for 10 or 15 seconds.Due to the problem with the scroll wheel I am buying another mouse, and probably a different brand.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2020
review.title: Lasted me four years!
review.review: Mostly an MMO player here, and this has been a great mouse for me.Good quality, software's easy to use, buttons are responsive and fully macroable, and the on-board storage saves your macro choices so you can use it on any computer the same way.One small complaint is that the... coating?on the sides comes right off after a very short amount of use.I ended up peeling most of it off because it was getting unsightly in the first six months.That said, the plastic underneath is just fine, so peeling off the coating doesn't harm anything, just looks kinda grungy and the peeling coating can be an annoying feeling until you get it all off.This one's lasted me since May 2016; just recently the left-forward side button has stopped responding, though.All the other buttons are still fine.I'm given to understand that this one's out of production, which is very saddening; hopefully their new stuff is just as good.For now I'm buying one more copy of this mouse, and we'll see if it lasts me another four years!
product.title: SteelSeries Sensei Laser Gaming Mouse RAW - Rubberized Black

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2019
review.title: I really want to love this mouse... EDIT
review.review: EDIT: Lowered this to a 1 star review. I have had this mouse for 8 months and the scroll wheel is already failing. Every few clicks on the downward scroll results in an upward bounce. Same reason I got rid of my last Sensei, but I had that mouse for years. Not sure what's up with the quality of their mice these days, but I'd avoid them at all costs.I had a SteelSeries Sensei RAW for years, and it was great for everything I used it for. When it finally came time to replace it, ended up buying another. But in less than 3 months, this mouse is already looking like it's headed for the trash can. In general, it functions just as well as the last one I had, but this mouse puts out a horrible, high-pitch noise when it's idle. For more than 30 seconds after you stop moving the mouse, or if you bump it, or the table shakes a bit, there is a sustained high-pitch tone that I cannot drown out. And while it's less obvious when competing with other noises, for me it is still quite noticeable, and it's driving me insane.
product.title: SteelSeries Sensei Laser Gaming Mouse RAW - Rubberized Black

I wear glasses too. no problem. they might feel weird at first, you just have to find the right fit with the velcro. they sit on your head and around your ears so seamlessly.the mic is basically what you would expect from a headset. it doesn't sound incredible but it's good for what you pay for. it's better than most i've heard.has a volume scroll wheel on the left ear to raise or lower your volume. very nice.its great,buy it.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
review.title: Mediocre pricey headset
review.review: I picked these up to replace a broken pair of Turtle beach Stealth 520s.The 520s were cheap <$100 and did the job as intended.Honestly I would prefer to go back with them,and not this Artis 7 headset.My biggest gripe is that I cannot use the headset to control Chat and Audio separately,You need to use the PlayStation console to do this,and its annoying as Heck!That feature alone makes the cheaper Turtle beach headset dominate these things.Another point of contention is how long you need to push the power button down to turn them on..Literally 4 Mississippi's before they beep and power up.The instructions say that you need to hold the power button down for 5 seconds to pair it,beware.... it has gone into that mode rather then turn on a few times.Sound quality is passable but not exceptional or worth noting and at this price point its disappointing.Positives..They fit better then the Stealth 520sbut are actually abit heavier,will need to see how they sit on the long term.Battery life so far is good on par with my old set,microphone is overly complicated and cannot be removed from the headset.Not a big deal,but worth noting.Summary...Mediocre pricey headset..They do nothing outstanding,and controlling audio is super annoying with these.Sound quality is good but not great,Noise cancelling is non existent.I use for gaming,would not recommend these for any audiophiles.Wired headsets on the cheap end perform better.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2021
review.title: Great...When it works....
review.review: Pros:- Great overall sound when using the speakers- Comfortable and adjusts nicely- Solid construction- Retractable Mic boom is nice and works- BluetoothCons:- Will randomly shut off without warning, or cut out before just turning off (tried with 2 different pairs)- Can only use EITHER the Speakers or Headset but not both- Constantly have to toggle which audio is being used by which device at which time- No batter indicator- Steelseries software is mostly just bloat and offers zero actual functionalityTL;DR; Speakers are great, "headset audio" is garbage (unless doing video/voice calls for work)If you are getting these to connect with your Macbook for work calls, great. The Bluetooth seems to work well with Macs. If you are planning on gaming with them then go pick up a cheaper pair of something because you cannot have nice audio (speakers) & voice-chat (headset) at the same time due to the way the codecs are setup for Bluetooth. Also Windows Bluetooth (tried multiple adapters and built-in BT) will randomly drop the connection. I just wanted a nice headset that just worked, and what I got was a nice headset that sometimes turns itself off, and having to choose between chatting with friends OR hearing my game. Works with Xbox (as it advertises) but I assume like with everything else it is using the headset so you can chat and hear audio which makes the audio garbage.

review.title: Doesn't stay connected. Poor sound qualityu
review.review: Connected to a PC. Headphones do not stay connected. Constant dropping signal while playing games or listening to music. Sound is often garbled. Static noise coming through headset. Requested a replacement but the problems are the same. I live in an apartment complex so there may be alot of 2.4 ghz interference. I will be purchasing a bluetooth or wired headset to replace them.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2021
review.title: Highly polished trash
review.review: Low quality speakers with a constant hissing sound even when the base station is not connected.Ear makes contact with the inside of the headphones causing pain (even after significant adjusting). Some reviews mention aftermarket earpads might solve this issue, however after spending $350 on this garbage I wouldn't expect to need to replace the parts out of the box.Also had multiple complaints from people I attempted to communicate with online with the microphone on this unit.The search for a comfortable wireless headset continues.
product.title: SteelSeries Arctis Pro Wireless Gaming Headset - Lossless High Fidelity Wireless + Bluetooth for PS5/PS4 and PC - Black

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2021
review.title: Absolutely lovely
review.review: I use this product for work and play sometimes over 17 hours a day with minimal discomfort.The only issues I'm having are with the cord liking to wrap and twist on itself and needing to be unwound frequently lest it start to fray the cables.Sound quality is absolutely perfect for knowing exactly where my enemies in COD are... Usually right behind me about to slash my throat.And I've had several people on discord ask me what microphone I'm using as the sound quality is crisp and clear.I even use the microphone to record messages for the phone line at work with exceeding quality.Will probably buy the wireless version next time, but I will be using this line going forward so long as it reminds available.
product.title: SteelSeries Arctis Pro Wireless Gaming Headset - Lossless High Fidelity Wireless + Bluetooth for PS5/PS4 and PC - Black

review.title: Acrtis has no customer service
review.review: My son loved these for about 3 months then the charging port stopped working. Tried to contact Arctis and they were incredibly difficult to find a way to contact . Finally I found an email and when they got back to me they wanted me to jump through million hoops just to get a replacement,they wanted the receipt from Amazon but it couldn't be a mobile copy had to come from a computer which I don't have, then they want multiple pictures.I tried again to contact them about the issues I was having getting the information they wanted and never got a response so I was never able to get a replacement. Horrible Horrible customer service!

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2021
review.title: Great...When it works....
review.review: Pros:- Great overall sound when using the speakers- Comfortable and adjusts nicely- Solid construction- Retractable Mic boom is nice and works- BluetoothCons:- Will randomly shut off without warning, or cut out before just turning off (tried with 2 different pairs)- Can only use EITHER the Speakers or Headset but not both- Constantly have to toggle which audio is being used by which device at which time- No batter indicator- Steelseries software is mostly just bloat and offers zero actual functionalityTL;DR; Speakers are great, "headset audio" is garbage (unless doing video/voice calls for work)If you are getting these to connect with your Macbook for work calls, great. The Bluetooth seems to work well with Macs. If you are planning on gaming with them then go pick up a cheaper pair of something because you cannot have nice audio (speakers) & voice-chat (headset) at the same time due to the way the codecs are setup for Bluetooth. Also Windows Bluetooth (tried multiple adapters and built-in BT) will randomly drop the connection. I just wanted a nice headset that just worked, and what I got was a nice headset that sometimes turns itself off, and having to choose between chatting with friends OR hearing my game. Works with Xbox (as it advertises) but I assume like with everything else it is using the headset so you can chat and hear audio which makes the audio garbage.
product.title: SteelSeries Arctis 9X Wireless Gaming Headset – Integrated Xbox Wireless + Bluetooth – 20+ Hour Battery Life – for Xbox On...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2021
review.title: You’ll want to toss your beats in the trash.
review.review: This headset changed everything about how I hear music. On ps4 it was a great headset, but it didn’t blow me away. On PC it’s a different animal. The high res mode paired with Amazon HD music blew me away, and instead of gaming I spent the first few days hearing songs in a way I never had before. There’s no way I can describe it, but if you’ve never experienced high quality music do yourself a huge favor and try it out. Oh yeah, it’s really comfortable and great for gaming too...

review.review_data: Reviewed in Germany on October 3, 2021
review.title: Ein gutes Headset, hier kann man nicht meckern!
review.review: Das Headset sitzt sehr gut auf dem Kopf, Tonqualität ist hier wirklich gut, das Micro hat ebenfalls eine klare und gute Qualität. Das Preisleistungsverhältnis überzeugt hier, klar geht da noch mehr, da muss man aber tiefer in die Tasche greifen. Bin eigentlich kein Dauer Benutzer eines Headsets, deshalb reicht es für mich total aus. Ein Minus punkt muss ich allerdings erwähnen, man kann das Headset nicht mit der Steel Engine verbinden und somit über die Engine steuern. Das finde ich recht schade, da ich meine Steel Maus darüber steuern kann, hätte hier alles super gepasst. Leider ist dies mit dem Headset nicht möglich.Sonst kann ich nichts Negatives bemerken, bin Allgemein wirklich Zufrieden!.
product.title: SteelSeries Arctis 3 - All-Platform Gaming Headset - for PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, VR, Android and iOS...

review.review_data: Reviewed in Spain on September 23, 2021
review.title: BONITO DISEÑO. BUEN SONIDO
review.review: The media could not be loaded. 7️⃣ VALORACIÓNEn muchos de las reviews que hay de auriculares, estos modelos son los que más valoraciones positivas consiguen. Hablamos de una gama media de auriculares por menos de 100€Todos estos modelos cuenta con un bonito diseño y buena calidad de sonido, por lo que la diferencia entre ellosse base en pequeños matices o accesorios incluidos.En el caso de estos auriculares SteelSeries Arctis 3, estamos ante unos auriculares con etiqueta gaming, pero con un diseño elegante y de calidad.Lo que más destacaría de este modelo es su comodidad junto a con su calidad de sonido, aunque bajo mi punto de vista, está un poco por debajo que el Logitech G PRO o el HyperX Cloud Alpha Pro. La diferencia eneste modelo, es que NO viene con la tarjeta de sonido USB incluida.En cuanto a su comodidad, la diadema es de plástico duro y tiene una goma que es la que se adapta a tu cabeza. Esta goma es ajustable. Las orejeras, con de espuma, muy cómodas lo que los hace unos auriculares realmente agradables.Cualquiera de los otros modelos de auriculares presentan una gran comodidad, si bien, el Logitech G PRO y el modelo de HyperX Cloud Alpha Pro puede que tenga una presión en los laterales, un poco más acentuada. Para mi no es algo muy significativo ya que no noto gran diferencia, pero puede que alguien que por ejemplo use gafas, puede fijarse más en estos detalles.Yo buscaba unos auriculares que tuviesen el micro y el cable de audio extraíble y que pudiese encontrar fácilmente repuestos. Estos auriculares cuentan con dos conexiones jack 3.5mm en un auricular, sin embargo, el micrófono NO es extraible, sino que es retráctil, se oculta dentro de al auricular izquierdo.Tiene un control de volumen lo tienes en el propio auricular, a diferencia de otros modelos, que tienen el control en el propio cable.✅ CONCLUSIÓNUnos auriculares con un relación calidad/precio justa. Unos auriculares gaming a buen precio. MUY RECOMENDABLES🎧 CARACTERÍSTICAS AURICULARES✳️ STEELSERIES ARCTIS 3🟢 PROS• Buen sonido• Cable sonido extraíble• Micrófono integrado extensible• Los auriculares son orientables🔴 CONTRAS• No trae tarjeta USB de sonido• No trae funda de viaje• El micrófono no es extraíble• No son plegables• El ajuste es un poco engorroso. Viene con una tira de velcro✳️ LOGITECH G PRO🟢 PROS• Buen sonido• Viene con tarjeta USB de sonido• Cable sonido extraíble• Micrófono extraíble• Buen ajuste🔴 CONTRAS• No viene con funda de viaje• Los auriculares no son orientables• No son plegables✳️HYPERX CLOUD ALPHA PRO🟢 PROS• Buen sonido• Cable sonido extraíble• Micrófono extraíble• Buen ajuste• Viene con funda de viaje🔴 CONTRAS• No trae tarjeta USB de sonido• Los auriculares no son orientables• No son plegables✳️ RAZER BLACKSHARK V2🟢 PROS• Micrófono extraíble• Cómodos• Viene con tarjeta USB de sonido• Viene con funda de viaje🔴 CONTRAS• Sonido un poco bajo• El cable de sonido no es extraíble• No son plegables• Ajuste de altura de auriculares un poco endeble🏆 RANKING PRESTACIONES🥇 MEJOR PRESENTACIÓN1. review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020
review.title: Return / Warranty Policy For Defective Devices Is Awful
review.review: I purchased this for my son in April, after a few months it started acting up.I was able to fix it with the reset option and just went about using it.A month later the mic stopped working so I submitted a support ticket.Support asks you to do one thing at a time in their responses and trickles steps so that either you get frustrated by not hearing from someone for days or you forget to check the status and have to restart a ticket.And the previous ticket is closed.Support doesn't seem to have a clue about what has been previously said, done, or submitted - so you're starting over.And despite there being a way to preview the following tickets, Support asks for everything again, only leading to more delays.Responses can take days and multiple follow ups.Once basic troubleshooting doesn't resolve, Support requests will start with asking for pictures of the box from all angles and a copy of the Amazon invoice - then it changes to - no pictures of the box, only of the headset, and instructions on how to "snip" your Amazon invoice.All to keep what should be a SIMPLE Return lasting for weeks, if not months.At one point, I was sent instructions to destroy the headset by cutting it in half.I was reluctant and apprehensive if the device would be replaced so I followed up with Support about my concerns.Guess what, no one responded and assured me the device would be replaced so the ticket got "closed".And I had to start over!Then I was told that the Arctis 7 was "out of stock" so getting the replacement may be delayed.Really?So what happens if the warranty expires and the Arctis 7 is still out of stock.I have no faith SteelSeries will actually make good on the defective product.I hope my son gets the defective device replace, and unfortunately, it will be the last time we buy a SteelSeries product.
product.title: SteelSeries Arctis 7 - Wireless Gaming Headset - DTS Headphone:X v2.0 Surround for PC and PlayStation 4 - White [2019 Edit...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020
review.title: It's just not that great
review.review: I watched so many reviews on this headset and I have to say everything is absolutely ABYSMAL.Let's start with the positives. Its wireless.Ok the negatives. To maximise the headphones capabilities you need to manipulate how loud certain frequencies are at otherwise the sound will just not be as optimal. Songs will have less impact, audio from movies, TV shows feels flat. Then we have the actual application the Steel Series engine 3. My god what a mess... Anytime a headset needs an additional program feels like an incomplete product. I get it if people who are more well versed in headphones will enjoy tinkering with the details but the system just didn't work. So much trial and error just to get feedback on the microphone because the "noise cancelling" part of the headphones literally makes me feel like my head is being crushed."DTS Headphone:X v2.0 Surround for PC" Yea ok buddy, I tested surround sound with a headset that did have surround sound and tried it on a YouTube video that had capabilities for surround. Did not work for Arctis 7. Everything at the same volume no panning to either side. If you're buying this as a "gaming headset" look elsewhere.Look there are almost 0 reason to actually go for wireless headset besides the fact that it has no wires. Sure you could go to your bathroom while having it on but that really is it. Nice battery life I still have to charge the damn thing. Basically you still have a cord but you can occasinally take it off and still hear you sick beats woohoo.TL:DR: Its a very average wireless headset, there's no surround sound so don't bother with fps games with this headset, you are basically putting yourself at an disadvantage. Looks nice though.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2020
review.title: Wish it was louder.
review.review: So this is my first product away from the Logitech brand since I was disappointed in the static I was receiving out of the G935 Wireless.It took me awhile before I decided to go with the SteelSeries Arctis 7.I can say that this headset is light and comfortable, however I do wish it was bigger and a bit heavier to cover my entire ear. I'd argue the G935 is more comfortable, but when buying this, what I was looking for was better surround sound which it delivers to an extent.I don't have a big head, but I believe having it a bit bigger will help cover more sound and have a better immersive surround sound.The connectivity range is really far, much farther than the G935.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The con that this headset does have is that it is not loud enough compared to the G935.I find it funny that this was listed by many as the top wireless headset.The mic quality is okay, but if you were to look up, you would have to tweak it a bit because there are times when your microphone has an echo.It's really tough to find a list of top high end wireless headsets with surround sound without pricing impacting the list.For the price, I would say that this is not worth it. It's more expensive than the Logitech WIreless G935.------------------------------------------I'm still waiting for the day Bose makes a gaming headset.
product.title: SteelSeries Arctis 7 - Wireless Gaming Headset - DTS Headphone:X v2.0 Surround for PC and PlayStation 4 - White [2019 Edit...

review.review: lightweight, yes.LED functionality, yes.change the colors, yes.USB-A to USB-C connection, yes.Steel Series gaming program functionality, yes.adjust the DPI, yes.in usual Steel Series fashion, you get a mouse that does what it says it will, lets you have colors that can breathe or stay solid in zones, and with adjustable sensitivity.i still find Steel Series to be a better deal than RAZR products and since my laptop automatically comes with a Steel Series keyboard, my devices can be synced together.i went with the wired because not only is it cheaper, i have a tendency to lose the mouse when it's wireless.this cable does disconnect from the mouse when you're transporting it.I'll likely leave it on otherwise because it's easier to keep track of. at $35, pretty happy.my only concern would be for the future.because if the design to make it lightweight by cutting out a geometric pattern, the inner circuitry is visible.it says water resistant which i'm guessing also applies to sweat resistant.i'm not a heavy hand sweater, but to anyone that is, i could see this being a problem in the future.i haven't had it long enough to determine for sure how much of a problem it would be.

review.title: Best Mid-grade optical gaming mouse
review.review: Sometimes you don't want a mouse with a bazillion buttons. You want it for work and gaming without spending a stupid amount of money. Enter the Steelseries Prime FPS gaming mouse....not too fancy, built well and is a real delight to use. Sturdy, rugged and accurate for gaming. This mouse is a great buy for the money and proves you don't need to spend $ hundreds on a mouse with 42 buttons. If you like your mice, simple and sturdy/well built, this is the mouse for you. I replaced my razer mouse because it was starting to double-click in gaming.
product.title: Sponsored Ad - SteelSeries Prime Mini Wireless FPS Gaming Mouse – 100 Hour Battery – USB-C – 18,000 CPI TrueMove Air Optic...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2021
review.title: Working well
review.review: Mice are like shoes, so it's difficult to say what works well for everyone. I use a mouse 14+ h/day for long days at work and then what time I can have saving the universe. I've owned about every brand, both wired and wireless. My latest venture with the SteelSeries was based off a YT vid review that just happened to play. I'd been using a Razer Viper Mini for the past year and while it was a good mouse, it's just a bit too mini for me (average size hands).I've been pleased so far with this mouse. The weight is lighter than most, which I've increasingly grown to appreciate. I don't care much for wireless mice, so this wired one was my preference. The cable is ok - no kinks and with my setup, no drag/pull as I'm moving around. I already had a SteelSeries keyboard, so the software worked without issue picking up the mouse and adjusting settings. I've never had issue with SteelSeries software before, so that's been a non-issue as well.The mouse feels pretty good and has no plastic stuck on the sides like some of SteelSeries other mice. Those glued on pieces are nothing short of a mess over time as they goop out and get on your desk/hands/mouse. This mouse is all solid and is comfortable for long usage times. Clickers work well andthe wheel was surprisingly better than I feared - not exactly smoot, not horribly bumpy.Overall, I like this mouse and for the money, feel like I got a good product for the cost. I generally go through mice every 1 to 3 years, depending on how they hold up. I'm hoping this holds up to the task.
product.title: Sponsored Ad - SteelSeries Prime Mini Wireless FPS Gaming Mouse – 100 Hour Battery – USB-C – 18,000 CPI TrueMove Air Optic...

review.title: Great Headset
review.review: I bought these as a renewed product that had scratches on it but when I got it, the headset itself was in perfect condition. So I'll write this as if they were new. The headset is awesome. I used the PRO before these and I believe they are basically the same. The 7 has a rechargeable battery and the power button has a light that flashes every once in a while and the color indicates the battery level. I game quite a bit and I charge it every 3 days. Have never had a dead battery. The headset rests nicely and the weight seems low and balanced. Also the ear muffs can be swapped out for third party ones if you wish, although the stock ones are very comfortable. I give this headset 10/10.

Also these things are super comfortable. My ears used to get hot from my old headset and I would get headaches after playing a couple hours. The arctis 5 comes with that ski head band that makes it fit to your head with squeezing it like a vice grips. Great headset.

review.review_data: Reviewed in Japan on September 26, 2021
review.title: 音が良い！
review.review: 「Arctis3」から「Arctis5」に買い替えました。FPSゲームで使用しています。「５」に替えたら、音がまるで違うことが素人でもハッキリわかるほど高音質です。「３」の時に既に同社のDACを使用していたので、定位性は問題なかったのですが、音質自体がレベルアップしている感じです。表現力がないのですが、音がさらにクリアになったというか、キレイになった感じがします。と同時にボリュームがアップしたのか、銃声が大きくで最初びっくりしました。残念なのが、DACに接続すると光らないって所ですかね。ま、光ったところで、着けてる自分は見えないんですけどね（笑）他にもPrimeとかProとかも検討したのですが、値段の割にレビューがあまり良くなかったので、安かった「５」に落ち着きましたが、値段と性能、どっちをとっても大満足の商品でした。

review.review_data: Reviewed in Japan on September 13, 2021
review.title: おすすめ。
review.review: PC用のヘッドセットが欲しくて以前に同社のヘッドセット使ってたこともあって購入。イヤーカフのところが合皮とかだとポロポロ取れてしまい、交換とか面倒だったのだけれど今回のは不要なのが〇USB接続して使うのがメインになりますが白にLEDRGBは中々映えますね。カッコイイです。音に関しても申し分ない音だとは思います。ステレオだと低音が不足してるかな？って感じです。中音と高音がその分よく出てて聞き取りやすい。故にサラウンドにするとこのヘッドセットの強みが出てきます。自分はFPSゲーはしないので足音がどうとかは割愛しますが音の響きがリアルになり、高音の抜け方も良くなり、中音は聞きやすく、低音はイコライザでちょっといじれば満足になります。手元のダイヤルでボイスチャットしやすい環境に一瞬でなれるのも魅力です。PS4など対応ゲーム機持ってないのでそこら辺の使用感はわかりませんがPCでバランスよく器用貧乏にこなせるアイテムとしてはオススメです。ソフトウェアでの調節などめんどくさいところもありますが一度設定して慣れてしまえばこれだけコスパのいい商品は他にはないんじゃないんでしょうか。

I'm going to try to get a replacement under warranty, but I'm just kinda disappointed that a headset that cost me $160 was made so poorly. review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2021
review.title: Great build quality, poor connection quality causes audio issues
review.review: The Headset looks great and sounds great when its not distorted and garbled. It's fine for an hour or so then it will randomly start distorting the audio and will persist till you power the headset off and back on. Razer claims this is a known issue with the new Xbox Series X but it falls short of what MS actually has to say about the issue. The only known issue for the integrated wireless xbox headsets is the audio cut out that requires you to wiggle the thumb sticks. While this headset does not suffer from this issue, I find Razers claims to be FALSE or missleading. I returned the first one and the replacement was even worse with this issue. If you are okay with powering the headset off every couple of hours then this may be the headset for you but I personally would have to recommend to pass on this one till Razer get this issue fixed.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2020
review.title: Cord always unplugs itself
review.review: This is a very good headset as far as sound quality goes. The surround sound is great, it sounds just like you'd expect it to. The microphone quality is also pretty decent. From what I can gather it's got little to no feedback, no echo, and no extra static noise. The bendable portion is also very handy. My biggest problem with the headset is the cord. It's terrible. The cords that connect the headset are like loose jigsaw pieces, and they're way too long for my use. If they get snagged on anything at all, not matter how light, they'll unplug from themselves. They are so extremely loose, almost no grip at all. I'm shocked they manage to stay together at all frankly.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2020
review.title: Bad connection and worse support
review.review: I think this headset is comfortable enough, but it has several problems. The headband when at it tightest still feels a bit on the loose side so it wouldn't be good for anyone who has a smallish head. My real complaint is the fact that there is a bad connection somewhere. It is likely where it connects to the audio jack cable. This results in the microphone frequently not working and only one side producing sound. When I contacted customer service, they gave me essentially no help at all. They did say that I was in luck as I could purchase another cable from their store though... Lucky me... I did not make that purchase, and I will not make any other purchases from this brand. That being said, when the thing is working properly, it actually sounds pretty good.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2021
review.title: Versatile Bluetooth Wireless Gaming Headset
review.review: I've had these this headset since about March/April 2020.I think most of the reviews I've read online covered them well.And they are correct is they are very versatile in their use.I've used them on my mobilephone (Android), PC, Ocuulus Quest 2 and PS4.Given what they are, they're not going to satisfy an audiophile.Probably not the best for very competitive gaming.The sound is solid.It is true that the volume is lower when using Bluetooh versus wired.A little disappointing.They're are not able to use Steelseries game audio engine.I never tried it when they could, so I cannot comment how much of difference they make.I do use them a lot of Zoom sessions and they work well.The one issue I have is that the earcoushins seem to absorb my sweat and head oils.They don't really get a stink, but can leave a residue on the desk or paper.The ear coushins are removable so they can be washed.They don't do great well in the clothes washer.They ring that keeps the coushin oval, tends to break.To be safe, either wash by hand or the dish washer.The ear coushins can be replaced--Steelseries or third party makers.The wired cord is about four feet long.This works fine for many situations such as the desk or connecting to gaming controller such as the PS4.I found it a little short and wasn't able to leave my desk.There are third party companies that make longer ones.I brought a small one for use the the Oculus Quest 2.I have considered some of their higher end Steelseries with Bluetooth, but this is the only one without needing to use a Bluetooth adapter, which means cannot easily use with mobile games.I assume at some point this will change as the games on that platform get more advance.I think these are excellent value at $100 or less in that they can be used across multiple platforms.It would be nice if the next version could be paired with multiple devices so they don't have to repaired when switching devices.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2021
review.title: THIS HEADSET IS AIMBOT. I'd buy again. One year later.
review.review: These are not Bluetooth. They are USB dongle wireless. The dongle is usb-c so it can be used with smartphones. I have it connected to a normal USB adapter to connect to my system. I used it for months with PS4 before purchasing a PS5. Works fine on both systems. It comes with a wired cord so there's an input for wired connectivity as well.On a full charge I'm able to game all day. I'd say around 12 hours at least. I like that it has a beeping indicator that let's you know when the battery is low. I've got through an entire 30 min warzone match before it died post notification. Exceptional battery life.This headset can be louder than it needs to be. I hear footsteps that my friends don't. I think they use cheap turtle beach or dollar store headsets. Whenever I'm spectating them in warzone I call out guys they SWEAR they don't hear. THIS HEADSET IS AIMBOT.I've recorded my games and listened to myself and the mic is super exceptional. Teammates have no issues hearing me. And at least while running it wirelessly, teammates don't hear their voice feedback while communicating. I think it has that feedback issue while running wired. Haven't tested that on PS5. I wouldn't run wired while gaming with friends but if you're playing solo it should be fine.My only gripe about this headset is the build quality. The headrest cushion is slightly detaching so it snags my "pretty black boy blonde hair" when I remove the headset as seen in pictures I provided. Praying it doesn't leave me bald overtime. This happened 2-3 months in of owning the headset. Possibly sooner. It's not an absolute deal breaker for me. I should probably super glue it back. However because of that, I'll be giving it 4 of 5 stars.If you want AIMBOT, if you want a wireless headset, if you want to hear all the footsteps in COD this headset is for you. If you don't want your hair snagged when removing... Don't get this headset. But that issue could possibly be fixed with super glue. I've used this headset for a full year. And no other technical issues.

review.title: Multi-System Headphones are good
review.review: I use these on my switch, PS4, and now they are relegated to living room PC duty (playing Cyberpunk no less).I found these to be capable headphones, though they are much better on the PC where you can use the app to get them to drive sounds properly. They are just fine for the Switch. Not too much intrusion, but I did end up using a set of analog plug headphones there because my M-Pows are simply better sounding without tuning them. You just have to remember that using analog also tears through the Switch's battery at a fast rate, which gets these a higher score in the end.Sound isolation is apparently very good or my hearing is going (possible). I don't hear the TV behind me.The battery lasts long enough for me as long as the cat doesn't pull the charging cable out of the box (grumble).I like the simplicity of these. They just work with a lot of systems, no fuss.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: Newer Version is TRASH; Don't Buy
review.review: The first legitimate headset I ever bought for PC gaming was the HyperX Cloud II (back in ~2015). Even when the mic stopped working properly, I bought mic replacements and continued using the headset because it was great. However, my headset finally began breaking and I've lost audio in one ear. Rather than try something new, I opted to continue with the tried and true Cloud II.The new headset is definitely a newer version of the Cloud II and it is utter TRASH. The audio is terrible and the noise-cancelling is bad in the sense that I can't hear myself talking enough and it actually makes it difficult to speak. The mic is also a downgrade from its original version. The USB dongle you can plug into has removed the backlight and I initially thought it was broken/inoperable before I realized they removed the light. Personal preference, but an annoying change.There are much better headsets out there; choose something else. I'm terribly disappointed in how the Cloud II has changed since the first time I purchased it.

review.title: Best Mid-grade optical gaming mouse
review.review: Sometimes you don't want a mouse with a bazillion buttons. You want it for work and gaming without spending a stupid amount of money. Enter the Steelseries Prime FPS gaming mouse....not too fancy, built well and is a real delight to use. Sturdy, rugged and accurate for gaming. This mouse is a great buy for the money and proves you don't need to spend $ hundreds on a mouse with 42 buttons. If you like your mice, simple and sturdy/well built, this is the mouse for you. product.title: Sponsored Ad - SteelSeries Prime+ FPS Gaming Mouse – 18,000 CPI TrueMove Pro+ Optical Sensor – 5 Programmable Buttons – Ma...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2021
review.title: Working well
review.review: Mice are like shoes, so it's difficult to say what works well for everyone. I use a mouse 14+ h/day for long days at work and then what time I can have saving the universe. I've owned about every brand, both wired and wireless. My latest venture with the SteelSeries was based off a YT vid review that just happened to play. I'd been using a Razer Viper Mini for the past year and while it was a good mouse, it's just a bit too mini for me (average size hands).I've been pleased so far with this mouse. The weight is lighter than most, which I've increasingly grown to appreciate. I don't care much for wireless mice, so this wired one was my preference. The cable is ok - no kinks and with my setup, no drag/pull as I'm moving around. I already had a SteelSeries keyboard, so the software worked without issue picking up the mouse and adjusting settings. I've never had issue with SteelSeries software before, so that's been a non-issue as well.The mouse feels pretty good and has no plastic stuck on the sides like some of SteelSeries other mice. Those glued on pieces are nothing short of a mess over time as they goop out and get on your desk/hands/mouse. This mouse is all solid and is comfortable for long usage times. Clickers work well andthe wheel was surprisingly better than I feared - not exactly smoot, not horribly bumpy.Overall, I like this mouse and for the money, feel like I got a good product for the cost. I generally go through mice every 1 to 3 years, depending on how they hold up. I'm hoping this holds up to the task.

review.title: Mediocre pricey headset
review.review: I picked these up to replace a broken pair of Turtle beach Stealth 520s.The 520s were cheap <$100 and did the job as intended.Honestly I would prefer to go back with them,and not this Artis 7 headset.My biggest gripe is that I cannot use the headset to control Chat and Audio separately,You need to use the PlayStation console to do this,and its annoying as Heck!That feature alone makes the cheaper Turtle beach headset dominate these things.Another point of contention is how long you need to push the power button down to turn them on..Literally 4 Mississippi's before they beep and power up.The instructions say that you need to hold the power button down for 5 seconds to pair it,beware.... it has gone into that mode rather then turn on a few times.Sound quality is passable but not exceptional or worth noting and at this price point its disappointing.Positives..They fit better then the Stealth 520sbut are actually abit heavier,will need to see how they sit on the long term.Battery life so far is good on par with my old set,microphone is overly complicated and cannot be removed from the headset.Not a big deal,but worth noting.Summary...Mediocre pricey headset..They do nothing outstanding,and controlling audio is super annoying with these.Sound quality is good but not great,Noise cancelling is non existent.I use for gaming,would not recommend these for any audiophiles.Wired headsets on the cheap end perform better.

I say decent because I have a bluetooth headset I use when I’m not streaming that sounds WAY better and is WAY more comfortable.These after 2.5 weeks sound distorted and static in the background.I’m EXTREMELY disappointed and would not recommend getting these!
product.title: SteelSeries Arctis 7 - Lossless Wireless Gaming Headset with DTS Headphone: X v2.0 Surround - for PC and PlayStation 4 - B...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: Super comfortable, great sound quality, relatively easy to set up.
review.review: I'm so glad I decided to just shell out the extra money for a good headset. Steelseries engine has preset equalizers. one is Flat, one is Voice, they sound like shit, as expected. but man, when you set the equalizer to Music? shiiiiiiiiiiit. these things sound incredible when you have some spotify blasting. just out of the box they sound good. but downloading the engine and trying different presets is nice.they're also super comfortable. the velcro makes it weird trying to find the right fit but it only takes 2 minutes of fidgeting around to find it. if that. the earpads are crazy soft and squishy, they feel great. I wear glasses too. no problem. they might feel weird at first, you just have to find the right fit with the velcro. they sit on your head and around your ears so seamlessly.the mic is basically what you would expect from a headset. it doesn't sound incredible but it's good for what you pay for. it's better than most i've heard.has a volume scroll wheel on the left ear to raise or lower your volume. very nice.its great,buy it.
product.title: SteelSeries Arctis 7 - Lossless Wireless Gaming Headset with DTS Headphone: X v2.0 Surround - for PC and PlayStation 4 - B...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: Best headset I've ever had.
review.review: I purchased this headset with a big leap of faith, and I've not been disappointed. I used to go through a new wired headset every year, and because of that, I decided to give this a try despite the vastly increased price point. To begin with, the sound quality of this headset is phenomenal and easily the same as the wired headsets that I've had in the past. Further, the headset is incredibly comfortable and I've sometimes forgotten that I've still got it on when I take a break after a long gaming session. Truly a product that I would recommend to friends and family if you can afford it.

I would highly recommend these headphones to anyone looking for great quality for a rather reasonable price!!!

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
review.title: Mediocre pricey headset
review.review: I picked these up to replace a broken pair of Turtle beach Stealth 520s.The 520s were cheap <$100 and did the job as intended.Honestly I would prefer to go back with them,and not this Artis 7 headset.My biggest gripe is that I cannot use the headset to control Chat and Audio separately,You need to use the PlayStation console to do this,and its annoying as Heck!That feature alone makes the cheaper Turtle beach headset dominate these things.Another point of contention is how long you need to push the power button down to turn them on..Literally 4 Mississippi's before they beep and power up.The instructions say that you need to hold the power button down for 5 seconds to pair it,beware.... it has gone into that mode rather then turn on a few times.Sound quality is passable but not exceptional or worth noting and at this price point its disappointing.Positives..They fit better then the Stealth 520sbut are actually abit heavier,will need to see how they sit on the long term.Battery life so far is good on par with my old set,microphone is overly complicated and cannot be removed from the headset.Not a big deal,but worth noting.Summary...Mediocre pricey headset..They do nothing outstanding,and controlling audio is super annoying with these.Sound quality is good but not great,Noise cancelling is non existent.I use for gaming,would not recommend these for any audiophiles.Wired headsets on the cheap end perform better.
product.title: SteelSeries Arctis 7 - Lossless Wireless Gaming Headset with DTS Headphone: X v2.0 Surround - for PC and PlayStation 4 - B...

Usually right behind me about to slash my throat.And I've had several people on discord ask me what microphone I'm using as the sound quality is crisp and clear.I even use the microphone to record messages for the phone line at work with exceeding quality.Will probably buy the wireless version next time, but I will be using this line going forward so long as it reminds available.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2021
review.title: Great...When it works....
review.review: Pros:- Great overall sound when using the speakers- Comfortable and adjusts nicely- Solid construction- Retractable Mic boom is nice and works- BluetoothCons:- Will randomly shut off without warning, or cut out before just turning off (tried with 2 different pairs)- Can only use EITHER the Speakers or Headset but not both- Constantly have to toggle which audio is being used by which device at which time- No batter indicator- Steelseries software is mostly just bloat and offers zero actual functionalityTL;DR; Speakers are great, "headset audio" is garbage (unless doing video/voice calls for work)If you are getting these to connect with your Macbook for work calls, great. The Bluetooth seems to work well with Macs. If you are planning on gaming with them then go pick up a cheaper pair of something because you cannot have nice audio (speakers) & voice-chat (headset) at the same time due to the way the codecs are setup for Bluetooth. Also Windows Bluetooth (tried multiple adapters and built-in BT) will randomly drop the connection. I just wanted a nice headset that just worked, and what I got was a nice headset that sometimes turns itself off, and having to choose between chatting with friends OR hearing my game. Works with Xbox (as it advertises) but I assume like with everything else it is using the headset so you can chat and hear audio which makes the audio garbage.
product.title: SteelSeries Arctis 9X Wireless Gaming Headset – Integrated Xbox Wireless + Bluetooth – 20+ Hour Battery Life – for Xbox On...

review.title: Steel series is a top dog.
review.review: The media could not be loaded. I like everything about this mouse. The software that steel series has created is the least system “invasive” as possible it literally pulls no load off the cpu and sub 500mb of ram. I keep it open in the tray icon to keep the custom lighting profile on the mouse. Mouse charges in about 30 minutes on a usb 3.0 to usb C charger. The charger goes in and out nice and easy you don’t have to guess which side to plug it in as other ports do and the dpi, and all around quality of the sensors keeps me rocking all the games I play with dead accuracy!

review.review: lightweight, yes.LED functionality, yes.change the colors, yes.USB-A to USB-C connection, yes.Steel Series gaming program functionality, yes.adjust the DPI, yes.in usual Steel Series fashion, you get a mouse that does what it says it will, lets you have colors that can breathe or stay solid in zones, and with adjustable sensitivity.i still find Steel Series to be a better deal than RAZR products and since my laptop automatically comes with a Steel Series keyboard, my devices can be synced together.i went with the wired because not only is it cheaper, i have a tendency to lose the mouse when it's wireless.this cable does disconnect from the mouse when you're transporting it.I'll likely leave it on otherwise because it's easier to keep track of. at $35, pretty happy.my only concern would be for the future.because if the design to make it lightweight by cutting out a geometric pattern, the inner circuitry is visible.it says water resistant which i'm guessing also applies to sweat resistant.i'm not a heavy hand sweater, but to anyone that is, i could see this being a problem in the future.i haven't had it long enough to determine for sure how much of a problem it would be.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2021
review.title: Best Mid-grade optical gaming mouse
review.review: Sometimes you don't want a mouse with a bazillion buttons. You want it for work and gaming without spending a stupid amount of money. Enter the Steelseries Prime FPS gaming mouse....not too fancy, built well and is a real delight to use. Sturdy, rugged and accurate for gaming. This mouse is a great buy for the money and proves you don't need to spend $ hundreds on a mouse with 42 buttons. If you like your mice, simple and sturdy/well built, this is the mouse for you. I replaced my razer mouse because it was starting to double-click in gaming.
product.title: Sponsored Ad - SteelSeries Prime+ FPS Gaming Mouse – 18,000 CPI TrueMove Pro+ Optical Sensor – 5 Programmable Buttons – Ma...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2021
review.title: Working well
review.review: Mice are like shoes, so it's difficult to say what works well for everyone. I use a mouse 14+ h/day for long days at work and then what time I can have saving the universe. I've owned about every brand, both wired and wireless. My latest venture with the SteelSeries was based off a YT vid review that just happened to play. I'd been using a Razer Viper Mini for the past year and while it was a good mouse, it's just a bit too mini for me (average size hands).I've been pleased so far with this mouse. The weight is lighter than most, which I've increasingly grown to appreciate. I don't care much for wireless mice, so this wired one was my preference. The cable is ok - no kinks and with my setup, no drag/pull as I'm moving around. I already had a SteelSeries keyboard, so the software worked without issue picking up the mouse and adjusting settings. I've never had issue with SteelSeries software before, so that's been a non-issue as well.The mouse feels pretty good and has no plastic stuck on the sides like some of SteelSeries other mice. Those glued on pieces are nothing short of a mess over time as they goop out and get on your desk/hands/mouse. This mouse is all solid and is comfortable for long usage times. Clickers work well andthe wheel was surprisingly better than I feared - not exactly smoot, not horribly bumpy.Overall, I like this mouse and for the money, feel like I got a good product for the cost. I generally go through mice every 1 to 3 years, depending on how they hold up. I'm hoping this holds up to the task.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: Completely useless for my target purpose (gaming)
review.review: I've had a SteelSeries Rival 310 for a couple of years now and am perfectly happy with it, but then I found out about this model which seemed like a straight upgrade to me after watching and reading a couple of reviews. After getting it out of the box, I was excited to test it out in my favorite game, DOTA 2. Very quickly however I found out that unlike the two side buttons of the Rival 310, which are extremely easy and super natural to press, all 5 of the side buttons of the Rival 5 were exceedingly difficult and unnatural to press, and also led to mouse movement due to the force required to press the buttons. Also, my thumb had to be in a very weird and cramped position to be able to press the side buttons at all. The big forward side button was basically impossible to press, and the up/down rocker was very difficult to press as well. From the natural thumb resting position, it requires a significant movement to be able to press even the closest two ("back/forward") buttons, unlike with the Rival 310 where those buttons are basically instant-press as soon as you think about them. Therefore, this mouse is completely unusable for playing Dota 2, and I would guess any other game.I have medium to slightly large sized hands, and I would imagine someone with very large hands / long fingers, or some specific grip style might be able to use the side buttons (I am using a standard grip), but for me they are completely unusable. Again, the Rival 310 side buttons are perfectly usable so I'm unsure why they decided to move them way out of reach.The other features of the mouse are fine, as is the build quality, although I heavily dislike the default-on lighting, and the fact that the RGB lighting settings are NOT stored on the mouse itself, so if you use it with a different PC or laptop on which you don't have the SteelSeries software installed, you are forced to have your mouse glow super bright in random colors. The cable is OK too.I hope they make a "real" upgraded version of the Rival 310, with more side buttons, that are natural to reach, like the two existing ones, and not this "apparent" upgrade which is really a huge downgrade.
product.title: SteelSeries Rival 3 Gaming Mouse - 8,500 CPI TrueMove Core Optical Sensor - 6 Programmable Buttons - Split Trigger Buttons...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: Unacceptable Battery Life
review.review: I would have thought battery life would be great considering how quickly the mouse goes to sleep, but what would otherwise be a solid mouse for the price is ruined by terrible battery life. I am having to replace the AAAs in my mouse what feels like every 1-2 weeks.There is a power saving setting in the Steelseries software, but it is locked at 150hz polling rate which makes even browsing the web clunky and unresponsive. I especially notice it in the scroll wheel, which feels like it drops roughly every other click.I would recommend this mouse only if you have a battery charging station within reach of your desk and can live with the inconvenience. I will be replacing mine with a Logitech G305, and I guess this will be a fine emergency backup as it is past the return period.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
review.title: Probably good, but mine wasn't.
review.review: Right off the bat, it's a comfortable mouse. Feels good for my hands, but your mileage may vary. That's basically where the good experiences end for me though.After a day of using it, the signal would cut out for seconds at a time. Tried a different usb port, tried a different machine entirely, it's either the dongle or the hardware in the mouse itself. Ok no problem, switched it to bluetooth and it worked for a bit but also would cut out occasionally though not as often as over the dongle.Ok, so I began troubleshooting. I downloaded the software and updated the firmware, which didn't help anything really, the mouse still had signal issues. Also of note is that the steelseries pc software is one of the more buggier third party apps I've experienced. At a certain point I needed to jump through hoops to get the mouse to update the DPI profiles properly like rapidly switching back and forth between bluetooth and radio in order to get the software to finally push the updated config to the mouse.So where does that leave you? Well, it's a crapshoot like 9 out of 10 modern "gaming" products. These companies cut corners somewhere, and usually a safe bet for them is to skimp on quality control. Despite this, people seem happy with the mouse, so buy it with free returns only just in case.
product.title: SteelSeries Rival 3 Gaming Mouse - 8,500 CPI TrueMove Core Optical Sensor - 6 Programmable Buttons - Split Trigger Buttons...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2021
review.title: Great Looking Keycaps With Added Peace of Mind
review.review: I bought these for my Corsair K70 Mk. 2 SE because I wasn't completely satisfied with the amount of light coming through the stock keycaps. These pudding style keys allow the RGB lighting to come through much brighter than the stock ones and make the lighting effects more impactful, especially those effects which utilize many colors.The main reason I went with the SteelSeries caps as opposed to other pudding-style caps is the inclusion of multiple sets of bottom row keys in this set. Some keyboards (like my Corsair unit) come with different sized bottom row keys, which are not compatible with all sets of keycaps. While this set of keycaps may cost a bit more than other sets out there, the inclusion of multiple sets of bottom keys gives some peace of mind that this set will fit your particular keyboard.Additionally, I like the feel of these keycaps better than the stock ones that ship with the Corsair K70 and I don't think that these get marked up as much from general use.Overall, these SteelSeries Pudding Keycaps are a welcome upgrade to my set up and the added assurance that this set gives by including multiple sizes of bottom row shouldn't be dismissed.
product.title: Sponsored Ad - SteelSeries PRISMCAPS - Double Shot Pudding-Style Keycaps - Durable PBT Thermoplastic - Compatible with a W...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2021
review.title: Coarse keycaps surface, uneven height
review.review: After I got this product I was excited to put this keycaps on my current apex 7 TKL. Although the installation was easy and the lighting effect does look great on this keycap, there are some issues that really bring down the whole experience for this product.I notice the height of keycaps H, L, and 8 are slight taller than the rest the keycaps, and it feels weird whenever I have to press those keycaps. I don't know if Steelseries made those keycaps taller on purpose, or it could be some quality control issues.The factory Apex 7 TKL's keycapshave a really smooth surface without a grainy feeling, and I like it. So I assume they would make the same texture with their PBT pudding keycaps. However, their PBT pudding keycaps is way more "coarse" that it would make your fingers feel uncomfortable touching the keycaps.I won't be returning this one, but hopefully Steelseries would listen to customer's feedback and make some adjustment to their product.

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2021
review.title: Almost perfect
review.review: These keys are great; non-standard keyboard owners rejoice! They were a little more expensive than the Hyper X pudding caps, but the font is better and there are included keys for standard and non-standard bottom rows. The feel is really nice, the home (F and J) keys have the raised bits, and the illumination factor is UNREAL. A picture can't really do justice to the diffusing factor in the white, bottom part of the keys - and yes, these keys still get plenty bright. The finish on the tops have a nice, slightly textured surface so your fingers don't slide. Nitpicking, if you look really closely, you can see a few dim spots in the traces (like the 8's and 0's), and the finish on the outside of the keys isn't perfect. For instance, on the space bar key there are some very small raised bumps on the top anterior of the black portion. These could probably be sanded off, and are most likely a product of how the black and white parts of the keys are molded. Overall, really nice, would buy again. Installed on a Corsair K70 (pictured).

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020
review.title: Return / Warranty Policy For Defective Devices Is Awful
review.review: I purchased this for my son in April, after a few months it started acting up.I was able to fix it with the reset option and just went about using it.A month later the mic stopped working so I submitted a support ticket.Support asks you to do one thing at a time in their responses and trickles steps so that either you get frustrated by not hearing from someone for days or you forget to check the status and have to restart a ticket.And the previous ticket is closed.Support doesn't seem to have a clue about what has been previously said, done, or submitted - so you're starting over.And despite there being a way to preview the following tickets, Support asks for everything again, only leading to more delays.Responses can take days and multiple follow ups.Once basic troubleshooting doesn't resolve, Support requests will start with asking for pictures of the box from all angles and a copy of the Amazon invoice - then it changes to - no pictures of the box, only of the headset, and instructions on how to "snip" your Amazon invoice.All to keep what should be a SIMPLE Return lasting for weeks, if not months.At one point, I was sent instructions to destroy the headset by cutting it in half.I was reluctant and apprehensive if the device would be replaced so I followed up with Support about my concerns.Guess what, no one responded and assured me the device would be replaced so the ticket got "closed".And I had to start over!Then I was told that the Arctis 7 was "out of stock" so getting the replacement may be delayed.Really?So what happens if the warranty expires and the Arctis 7 is still out of stock.I have no faith SteelSeries will actually make good on the defective product.I hope my son gets the defective device replace, and unfortunately, it will be the last time we buy a SteelSeries product.
product.title: SteelSeries Arctis 7 - Wireless Gaming Headset - DTS Headphone:X v2.0 Surround for PC and PlayStation 4 - White [2019 Edit...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020
review.title: It's just not that great
review.review: I watched so many reviews on this headset and I have to say everything is absolutely ABYSMAL.Let's start with the positives. Its wireless.Ok the negatives. To maximise the headphones capabilities you need to manipulate how loud certain frequencies are at otherwise the sound will just not be as optimal. Songs will have less impact, audio from movies, TV shows feels flat. Then we have the actual application the Steel Series engine 3. My god what a mess... Anytime a headset needs an additional program feels like an incomplete product. I get it if people who are more well versed in headphones will enjoy tinkering with the details but the system just didn't work. So much trial and error just to get feedback on the microphone because the "noise cancelling" part of the headphones literally makes me feel like my head is being crushed."DTS Headphone:X v2.0 Surround for PC" Yea ok buddy, I tested surround sound with a headset that did have surround sound and tried it on a YouTube video that had capabilities for surround. Did not work for Arctis 7. Everything at the same volume no panning to either side. If you're buying this as a "gaming headset" look elsewhere.Look there are almost 0 reason to actually go for wireless headset besides the fact that it has no wires. Sure you could go to your bathroom while having it on but that really is it. Nice battery life I still have to charge the damn thing. Basically you still have a cord but you can occasinally take it off and still hear you sick beats woohoo.TL:DR: Its a very average wireless headset, there's no surround sound so don't bother with fps games with this headset, you are basically putting yourself at an disadvantage. Looks nice though.
product.title: SteelSeries Arctis 7 - Wireless Gaming Headset - DTS Headphone:X v2.0 Surround for PC and PlayStation 4 - White [2019 Edit...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2020
review.title: Wish it was louder.
review.review: So this is my first product away from the Logitech brand since I was disappointed in the static I was receiving out of the G935 Wireless.It took me awhile before I decided to go with the SteelSeries Arctis 7.I can say that this headset is light and comfortable, however I do wish it was bigger and a bit heavier to cover my entire ear. I'd argue the G935 is more comfortable, but when buying this, what I was looking for was better surround sound which it delivers to an extent.I don't have a big head, but I believe having it a bit bigger will help cover more sound and have a better immersive surround sound.The connectivity range is really far, much farther than the G935.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The con that this headset does have is that it is not loud enough compared to the G935.I find it funny that this was listed by many as the top wireless headset.The mic quality is okay, but if you were to look up, you would have to tweak it a bit because there are times when your microphone has an echo.It's really tough to find a list of top high end wireless headsets with surround sound without pricing impacting the list.For the price, I would say that this is not worth it. It's more expensive than the Logitech WIreless G935.------------------------------------------I'm still waiting for the day Bose makes a gaming headset.
product.title: SteelSeries Arctis 7 - Wireless Gaming Headset - DTS Headphone:X v2.0 Surround for PC and PlayStation 4 - White [2019 Edit...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: Completely useless for my target purpose (gaming)
review.review: I've had a SteelSeries Rival 310 for a couple of years now and am perfectly happy with it, but then I found out about this model which seemed like a straight upgrade to me after watching and reading a couple of reviews. After getting it out of the box, I was excited to test it out in my favorite game, DOTA 2. Very quickly however I found out that unlike the two side buttons of the Rival 310, which are extremely easy and super natural to press, all 5 of the side buttons of the Rival 5 were exceedingly difficult and unnatural to press, and also led to mouse movement due to the force required to press the buttons. Also, my thumb had to be in a very weird and cramped position to be able to press the side buttons at all. The big forward side button was basically impossible to press, and the up/down rocker was very difficult to press as well. From the natural thumb resting position, it requires a significant movement to be able to press even the closest two ("back/forward") buttons, unlike with the Rival 310 where those buttons are basically instant-press as soon as you think about them. Therefore, this mouse is completely unusable for playing Dota 2, and I would guess any other game.I have medium to slightly large sized hands, and I would imagine someone with very large hands / long fingers, or some specific grip style might be able to use the side buttons (I am using a standard grip), but for me they are completely unusable. Again, the Rival 310 side buttons are perfectly usable so I'm unsure why they decided to move them way out of reach.The other features of the mouse are fine, as is the build quality, although I heavily dislike the default-on lighting, and the fact that the RGB lighting settings are NOT stored on the mouse itself, so if you use it with a different PC or laptop on which you don't have the SteelSeries software installed, you are forced to have your mouse glow super bright in random colors. The cable is OK too.I hope they make a "real" upgraded version of the Rival 310, with more side buttons, that are natural to reach, like the two existing ones, and not this "apparent" upgrade which is really a huge downgrade.
product.title: Sponsored Ad - SteelSeries Rival 5 Gaming Mouse with PrismSync RGB Lighting and 9 Programmable Buttons – FPS, MOBA, MMO, B...

review.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review.title: Unacceptable Battery Life
review.review: I would have thought battery life would be great considering how quickly the mouse goes to sleep, but what would otherwise be a solid mouse for the price is ruined by terrible battery life. I am having to replace the AAAs in my mouse what feels like every 1-2 weeks.There is a power saving setting in the Steelseries software, but it is locked at 150hz polling rate which makes even browsing the web clunky and unresponsive. I especially notice it in the scroll wheel, which feels like it drops roughly every other click.I would recommend this mouse only if you have a battery charging station within reach of your desk and can live with the inconvenience. I will be replacing mine with a Logitech G305, and I guess this will be a fine emergency backup as it is past the return period.
